YAHOO.widget.Panel.name: YAHOO.widget.Panel

draggable.description: Boolean specifying if the Panel should be draggable. The default value is "true" if the Drag and Drop utility is included, otherwise it is "false." PLEASE NOTE: There is a known issue in IE 6 (Strict Mode and Quirks Mode) and IE 7 (Quirks Mode) where Panels that either don't have a value set for their "width" configuration property, or their "width" configuration property is set to "auto" will only be draggable by placing the mouse on the text of the Panel's header element. To fix this bug, draggable Panels missing a value for their "width" configuration property, or whose "width" configuration property is set to "auto" will have it set to the value of their root HTML element's offsetWidth before they are made visible. The calculated width is then removed when the Panel is hidden. This fix is only applied to draggable Panels in IE 6 (Strict Mode and Quirks Mode) and IE 7 (Quirks Mode). For more information on this issue see: SourceForge bugs #1726972 and #1589210.

close.description: True if the Panel should display a "close" button

keylisteners.description:
A KeyListener (or array of KeyListeners) that will be enabled 
when the Panel is shown, and disabled when the Panel is hidden.

underlay.description: Sets the type of underlay to display for the Panel. Valid values are "shadow," "matte," and "none". PLEASE NOTE: The creation of the underlay element is deferred until the Panel is initially made visible. For Gecko-based browsers on Mac OS X the underlay elment is always created as it is used as a shim to prevent Aqua scrollbars below a Panel instance from poking through it (See SourceForge bug #836476).

modal.description:
True if the Panel should be displayed in a modal fashion, 
automatically creating a transparent mask over the document that
will not be removed until the Panel is dismissed.

params.description: The element ID representing the Panel OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Panel

params.name: userConfig
params.description:
The configuration object literal containing 
the configuration that should be set for this Panel. See configuration 
documentation for more details.

Panel is an implementation of Overlay that behaves like an OS window, 
with a draggable header and an optional close icon at the top right.

render.description:
Renders the Panel by inserting the elements that are not already in 
the main Panel into their correct places. Optionally appends the 
Panel to the specified node prior to the render's execution. NOTE: 
For Panels without existing markup, the appendToNode argument is 
REQUIRED. If this argument is ommitted and the current element is 
not present in the document, the function will return false, 
indicating that the render was a failure.

YAHOO.util.KeyListener.name: YAHOO.util.KeyListener
YAHOO.util.KeyListener.knownissue:
the "keypress" event is completely broken in Safari 2.x and below.
the workaround is use "keydown" for key listening.  However, if
it is desired to prevent the default behavior of the keystroke,
that can only be done on the keypress event.  This makes key
handling quite ugly.

event should be attached

event should be attached

The object literal representing the key(s) 
to detect. Possible attributes are 
shift(boolean), alt(boolean), ctrl(boolean) 
and keys(either an int or an array of ints 
representing keycodes).

params.name: handler
params.description:
The CustomEvent handler to fire when the 
key event is detected

params.name: handler
params.description: An object literal representing the handler.

params.name: event
params.description:
Optional. The event (keydown or keyup) to 
listen for. Defaults automatically to keydown.

KeyListener is a utility that provides an easy interface for listening for
keydown/keyup events fired against DOM elements.

Enables the KeyListener by attaching the DOM event listeners to the

Disables the KeyListener by removing the DOM event listeners from the

YAHOO.widget.Toolbar.name: YAHOO.widget.Toolbar

params.name: el
params.description: The element to turn into a toolbar.

params.name: attrs
params.description: Object liternal containing configuration parameters.

constructors.description: Provides a rich toolbar widget based on the button and menu widgets

toolbarExpanded.description: Fires when the toolbar is expanded via the collapse button. See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event.

params.name: o
params.description: The object passed to this handler is the button config used to create the button.

valueClick.description:
This is a special dynamic event that is created and dispatched based on the value property of the button config. See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event. Example: 
buttons : [
{ type: 'button', value: 'test', value: 'testButton' }
]
 With the valueClick event you could subscribe to this buttons click event with this: tbar.in('testButtonClick', function() { alert('test button clicked'); })

toolbarCollapsed.description: Fires when the toolbar is collapsed via the collapse button. See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event.

params.name: o
params.description: The object passed to this handler is the button config used to create the button.

buttonClick.description: Fires when any botton receives a click event. Passes back a single object representing the buttons config object. See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event.

YAHOO.util.Config.name: YAHOO.util.Config

params.name: owner
params.description: The owner Object to which this Config Object belongs

constructors.description:
Config is a utility used within an Object to allow the implementer to
maintain a list of local configuration properties and listen for changes 
to those properties dynamically using CustomEvent. The initial values are 
also maintained so that the configuration can be reset at any given point 
to its initial state.

configChangedEvent.description:
Custom Event, notifying subscribers when Config properties are set 
(setProperty is called without the silent flag

fireQueue.description: Fires the normalized list of queued property change events

return.description:
true, if the function/Object pair is already subscribed 
to the CustomEvent passed in

YAHOO.util.Config.alreadySubscribed.description:
Checks to determine if a particular function/Object pair are already 
subscribed to the specified CustomEvent

params.name: evt
params.description:
The CustomEvent for which to check 
the subscriptions

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to look for in the subscribers list

params.name: obj
params.description: The execution scope Object for the subscription

return.description: The value of the specified property

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

getProperty.description: Returns the value of specified property.

params.name: key
params.description: The configuration property's name

params.name: propertyObject
params.description:
The Object containing all of this 
property's arguments

addProperty.description: Adds a property to the Config Object's private config hash.

return.description:
true, if the set was successful, false if 
it failed.

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

params.name: value
params.description: The value to set the property to

queueProperty.description:
Sets the value of a property and queues its event to execute. If the 
event is already scheduled to execute, it is
moved from its current position to the end of the queue.

return.description: true, if the value is valid

params.name: val
params.description: The value to validate

checkNumber.description: Validates that the value passed in is a number.

return.description:
The string list of CustomEvents currently queued 
for execution

outputEventQueue.description:
Returns a string representation of the Config object's current 
CustomEvent queue

return.description: True is the property was reset, false if not

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

resetProperty.description: Resets the specified property's value to its initial value.

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration Object literal

params.name: init
params.description:
When set to true, the initialConfig will 
be set to the userConfig passed in, so that calling a reset will 
reset the properties to the passed values.

applyConfig.description:
Applies a key-value Object literal to the configuration, replacing  
any existing values, and queueing the property events.
Although the values will be set, fireQueue() must be called for their 
associated events to execute.

refresh.description:
Refires the events for all configuration properties using their 
current values.

return.description:
True, if the subscription was successful, 
otherwise false.

params.name: key
params.description: The property name

params.name: handler
params.description:
The handler function to use subscribe to 
the property's event

params.name: obj
params.description:
The Object to use for scoping the event handler 
(see CustomEvent documentation)

params.name: override
params.description:
Optional. If true, will override "this"  
within the handler to map to the scope Object passed into the method.

subscribeToConfigEvent.description:
Subscribes an external handler to the change event for any 
given property.

return.description: true, if the value is valid

params.name: val
params.description: The value to validate

checkBoolean.description: Validates that the value passed in is a Boolean.

params.name: owner
params.description:
The owner Object to which this Config 
Object belongs

init.description: Initializes the configuration Object and all of its local members.

return.description: The Config object in string format.

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the Config object

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

refireEvent.description: Fires the event for a property using the property's current value.

return.description: The current config, represented in a key-value map

getConfig.description:
Returns a key-value configuration map of the values currently set in  
the Config Object.

return.description: True, if the set was successful, false if it failed.

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

params.name: value
params.description: The value to set the property to

params.name: silent
params.description:
Whether the value should be set silently, 
without firing the property event.

setProperty.description:
Sets the value of a property. If the silent property is passed as 
true, the property's event will not be fired.

destroy.description:
Sets all properties to null, unsubscribes all listeners from each 
property's change event and all listeners from the configChangedEvent.

params.name: key
params.description: The configuration property's name

params.name: Object
params.description: The value of the correct type for the property

fireEvent.description: Fires a configuration property event using the specified value.

return.description:
True, if the unsubscription was successful, 
otherwise false.

params.name: key
params.description: The property name

params.name: handler
params.description:
The handler function to use subscribe to 
the property's event

params.name: obj
params.description:
The Object to use for scoping the event 
handler (see CustomEvent documentation)

unsubscribeFromConfigEvent.description:
Unsubscribes an external handler from the change event for any 
given property.

YAHOO.util.Config.CONFIG_CHANGED_EVENT.description: Constant representing the CustomEvent type for the config changed event.

eventQueue.description: Maintains the local, normalized CustomEvent queue

owner.description: Object reference to the owner of this Config Object

queueInProgress.description:
Boolean flag that specifies whether a queue is currently 
being executed

initialConfig.description:
Maintains the local collection of configuration property objects as 
they were initially applied.
This object is used when resetting a property.

config.description:
Maintains the local collection of configuration property objects and

YAHOO.util.Config.BOOLEAN_TYPE.description: Constant representing the boolean type string

YAHOO.util.Config.description:
Config is a utility used within an Object to allow the implementer to
maintain a list of local configuration properties and listen for changes 
to those properties dynamically using CustomEvent. The initial values are 
also maintained so that the configuration can be reset at any given point 
to its initial state.

YAHOO.widget.Node.name: YAHOO.widget.Node

params.name: oData
params.description:
a string or object containing the data that will
be used to render this node

params.name: oParent
params.description: this node's parent node

params.name: expanded
params.description: the initial expanded/collapsed state

constructors.description:
The base class for all tree nodes.  The node's presentation and behavior in
response to mouse events is handled in Node subclasses.

parentChange.description:
The parentChange event is fired when a parent element is applied
to the node.  This is useful if you need to apply tree-level
properties to a tree that need to happen if a node is moved from
one tree to another.

return.description: the child node

appendChild.description: Appends a node to the child collection.

params.name: childNode
params.description: the new node

params.name: fmDataLoader
params.description: the function that will be used to get the data.

params.name: iconMode
params.description:
configures the icon that is displayed when a dynamic
load node is expanded the first time without children.  By default, the 
"collapse" icon will be used.  If set to 1, the leaf node icon will be
displayed.

setDynamicLoad.description:
Configures this node for dynamically obtaining the child data
when the node is first expanded.  Calling it without the callback
will turn off dynamic load for the node.

return.description: this node's children div

getChildrenEl.description: Returns the div that was generated for this node's children

toggle.description: Expands if node is collapsed, collapses otherwise.

collapse\ntoggle style..description: Hides this nodes children (creating them if necessary), changes the

return.description: this node's toggle html element

getToggleEl.description: Returns the element that is being used for this node's toggle.

return.description: the markup for this node and its expanded children.

getHtml.description: Returns the markup for this node and its children.

return.description: the inserted node

params.name: node
params.description: the node to insert this node before

insertBefore.description: Inserts this node before this supplied node

return.description:
true if this has children or if it might and we are
checking for this condition.

params.name: checkForLazyLoad
params.description: should we check for unloaded children?

hasChildren.description:
Checks if this node has children.  If this node is lazy-loading and the
children have not been rendered, we do not know whether or not there
are actual children.  In most cases, we need to assume that there are
children (for instance, the toggle needs to show the expandable 
presentation state).  In other times we want to know if there are rendered
children.  For the latter, "checkForLazyLoad" should be false.

return.description: true if this node's children are to be loaded dynamically

isDynamic.description:
Evaluates if this node's children should be loaded dynamically.  Looks for
the property both in this instance and the root node.  If the tree is
defined to load all children dynamically, the data callback function is
defined in the root node

params.description:
a string or object containing the data that will

params.description: the node to append to.

does not have a next sibling

expandAll.description: Recursively expands all of this node's children.

return.description: the javascript url for toggling this node

getToggleLink.description: Generates the link that will invoke this node's toggle method

return.description: Node[]

getSiblings.description: Returns a node array of this node's siblings, null if none.

return.description: the css class for this node's toggle

getStyle.description: Returns the css style name for the toggle

return.description: The HTML that will render this node.

getNodeHtml.description:
Get the markup for the node.  This is designed to be overrided so that we can
support different types of nodes.

return.description: 0 for collapse style, 1 for leaf node style

getIconMode.description:
Returns the current icon mode.  This refers to the way childless dynamic
load nodes appear.

return.description: the ancestor

params.name: depth
params.description: the depth of the ancestor.

getAncestor.description: Returns this node's ancestor at the specified depth.

loadComplete.description:
Load complete is the callback function we pass to the data provider
in dynamic load situations.

expand.description:
Shows this nodes children (creating them if necessary), changes the
toggle style, and collapses its siblings if multiExpand is not set.

return.description: the element id

getElId.description: Returns the id for this node's container div

return.description: true if this is the root node

isRoot.description: Evaluates if this node is the root node of the tree

return.description: children html

completeRender.description: Called when we know we have all the child data.

return.description:
The node index if this Node is a child of 
supplied Node, else -1.

isChildOf.description: Returns true if the Node is a child of supplied Node

params.name: parentNode
params.description: the Node to check

return.description: the children container div html and any expanded children

getChildrenHtml.description:
Called when first rendering the tree.  We always build the div that will
contain this nodes children, but we don't render the children themselves
unless this node is expanded.

refresh.description:
Regenerates the html for this node and its children.  To be used when the
node is expanded and new children have been added.

return.description: the toggel element id

getToggleElId.description: Returns the id for this node's toggle element

return.description: the html for this node's children

renderChildren.description:
Generates the markup for the child nodes.  This is not done until the node
is expanded.

return.description: the css class hover state

getHoverStyle.description: Returns the hover style for the icon

collapseAll.description: Recursively collapses all of this node's children.

return.description: true if the application was successful

params.name: parentNode
params.description: this node's parent node

applyParent.description:
Certain properties for the node cannot be set until the parent
is known. This is called after the node is inserted into a tree.
the parent is also applied to this node's children in order to
make it possible to move a branch from one tree to another.

childrenRendered.description:
This flag is set to true when the html is generated for this node's
children, and set to false when new children are added.

renderHidden.description:
Should we render children for a collapsed node?  It is possible that the
implementer will want to render the hidden data...  @todo verify that we 
need this, and implement it if we do.

iconMode.description:
Used to configure what happens when a dynamic load node is expanded
and we discover that it does not have children.  By default, it is
treated as if it still could have children (plus/minus icon).  Set
iconMode to have it display like a leaf node instead.

href.description:
The href for the node's label.  If one is not specified, the href will
be set so that it toggles the node.

isLoading.description:
This is true for dynamically loading nodes while waiting for the
callback to return.

nowrap.description:
Specifies whether or not the content area of the node should be allowed
to wrap.

multiExpand.description: Can multiple children be expanded at once?

index.description: The index for this instance obtained from global counter in YAHOO.widget.TreeView.

_dynLoad.description:
We can set the node up to call an external method to get the child
data dynamically.

dataLoader.description: Function to execute when we need to get this node's child data.

data.description:
The data linked to this node.  This can be any object or primitive
value, and the data can be used in getNodeHtml().

dynamicLoadComplete.description:
Dynamically loaded nodes only fetch the data the first time they are
expanded.  This flag is set to true once the data has been fetched.

hasIcon.description:
The toggle/branch icon will not show if this is set to false.  This
could be useful if the implementer wants to have the child contain
extra info about the parent, rather than an actual node.

target.description: The label href target, defaults to current window

tree.description: Tree instance this node is part of

depth.description: The depth of this node.  We start at -1 for the root node.

YAHOO.widget.Node.description:
The base class for all tree nodes.  The node's presentation and behavior in
response to mouse events is handled in Node subclasses.

YAHOO.util.Motion.name: YAHOO.util.Motion

params.name: el
params.description: Reference to the element that will be animated

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attribute(s) to be animated.  
Each attribute is an object with at minimum a "to" or "by" member defined.  
Additional optional members are "from" (defaults to current value), "units" (defaults to "px").  
All attribute names use camelCase.

params.name: duration
params.description: (optional, defaults to 1 second) Length of animation (frames or seconds), defaults to time-based

params.name: method
params.description: (optional, defaults to YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone) Computes the values that are applied to the attributes per frame (generally a YAHOO.util.Easing method)

constructors.description:
Anim subclass for moving elements along a path defined by the "points" member of "attributes". All "points" are arrays with x, y coordinates.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Motion(el, { points: { to: [800, 800] } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

YAHOO.util.DataSource.name: YAHOO.util.DataSource

params.name: oLiveData
params.description: Pointer to live database.

params.name: oConfigs
params.description: (optional) Object literal of configuration values.

constructors.description:
The DataSource class defines and manages a live set of data for widgets to
interact with. Examples of live databases include in-memory
local data such as a JavaScript array, a JavaScript function, or JSON, or
remote data such as data retrieved through an XHR connection.

DataSource._nTransactionId.description: Internal class variable to assign unique transaction IDs.

TYPE_HTMLTABLE.description: Type is an HTML TABLE element.

maxCacheEntries.description:
Max size of the local cache.  Set to 0 to turn off caching.  Caching is
useful to reduce the number of server connections.  Recommended only for data
sources that return comprehensive results for queries or when stale data is
not an issue.

_oQueue.description: Local queue of request connections, enabled if queue needs to be managed.

TYPE_XHR.description: Type is hosted on a server via an XHR connection.

DataSource._nIndex.description: Internal class variable to index multiple DataSource instances.

dataType.description: Where the live data is held.

_aCache.description: Local cache of data result object literals indexed chronologically.

connTimeout.description:
If data is accessed over XHR via Connection Manager, the connection timeout
defines how many  milliseconds the XHR connection will wait for a server
response. Any non-zero value will enable the Connection utility's
Auto-Abort feature.

responseSchema.description:
Response schema object literal takes a combination of the following properties:
<dl>
<dt>resultsList</dt> <dd>Pointer to array of tabular data</dd>
<dt>resultNode</dt> <dd>Pointer to node name of row data (XML data only)</dd>
<dt>recordDelim</dt> <dd>Record delimiter (text data only)</dd>
<dt>fieldDelim</dt> <dd>Field delimiter (text data only)</dd>
<dt>fields</dt> <dd>Array of field names (aka keys), or array of object literals
such as: {key:"fieldname",parser:YAHOO.util.DataSource.parseDate}</dd>
</dl>

connXhrMode.description:
If data is accessed over XHR via Connection Manager, this setting defines
request/response management in the following manner:
<dl>
<dt>queueRequests</dt>
<dd>If a request is already in progress, wait until response is returned
before sending the next request.</dd>
<dt>cancelStaleRequests</dt>
<dd>If a request is already in progress, cancel it before sending the next
request.</dd>
<dt>ignoreStaleResponses</dt>
<dd>Send all requests, but handle only the response for the most recently
sent request.</dd>
<dt>allowAll</dt>
<dd>Send all requests and handle all responses.</dd>
</dl>

ERROR_DATANULL.description: Error message for null data responses.

connMethodPost.description:
If data is accessed over XHR via Connection Manager, true if data should be
sent via POST, otherwise data will be sent via GET.

connMgr.description:
Alias to YUI Connection Manager. Allows implementers to specify their own
subclasses of the YUI Connection Manager utility.

Default overridable method matches given request to given cached request.
Returns true if is a hit, returns false otherwise.  Implementers should

before the data gets parsed. Implementers should take care not to return an
unparsable or otherwise invalid raw response.

YAHOO.util.DataSource.description:
The DataSource class defines and manages a live set of data for widgets to
interact with. Examples of live databases include in-memory
local data such as a JavaScript array, a JavaScript function, or JSON, or
remote data such as data retrieved through an XHR connection.

YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.name: YAHOO.util.CustomEvent

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of event, which is passed to the callback
when the event fires

params.name: oScope
params.description:
The context the event will fire from.  "this" will
refer to this object in the callback.  Default value: 
the window object.  The listener can override this.

params.name: silent
params.description:
pass true to prevent the event from writing to
the debugsystem

params.name: signature
params.description:
the signature that the custom event subscriber
will receive. YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.LIST or 
YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.FLAT.  The default is
YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.LIST.

constructors.description:
The CustomEvent class lets you define events for your application
that can be subscribed to by one or more independent component.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to execute

params.name: obj
params.description:
An object to be passed along when the event 
fires

params.name: override
params.description:
If true, the obj passed in becomes 
the execution scope of the listener.
if an object, that object becomes the
the execution scope.

subscribeEvent.description:
Custom events provide a custom event that fires whenever there is
a new subscriber to the event.  This provides an opportunity to
handle the case where there is a non-repeating event that has
already fired has a new subscriber.

return.description:
false if one of the subscribers returned false, 
true otherwise

params.name: arguments
params.description:
an arbitrary set of parameters to pass to 
the handler.

fire.description:
Notifies the subscribers. The callback functions will be executed from the scope specified when the event was created, and with the following parameters:
  • The type of event
  • All of the arguments fire() was executed with as an array
  • The custom object (if any) that was passed into the subscribe() method

return.description: The number of listeners unsubscribed

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to execute

params.name: obj
params.description:
An object to be passed along when the event 
fires

params.name: override
params.description:
If true, the obj passed in becomes 
the execution scope of the listener.
if an object, that object becomes the
the execution scope.

subscribe.description: Subscribes the caller to this event

return.description: True if the subscriber was found and detached.

params.name: fn
params.description:
The subscribed function to remove, if not supplied
all will be removed

params.name: obj
params.description:
The custom object passed to subscribe.  This is
optional, but if supplied will be used to
disambiguate multiple listeners that are the same
(e.g., you subscribe many object using a function
that lives on the prototype)

silent.description:
By default all custom events are logged in the debug build, set silent
to true to disable debug outpu for this event.

YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.FLAT.description:
Subscriber listener sigature constant.  The FLAT type returns two
parameters: the first argument passed to fire and the optional 
custom object

signature.description:
Custom events support two styles of arguments provided to the event subscribers.
  • YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.LIST:
    • param1: event name
    • param2: array of arguments sent to fire
    • param3: a custom object supplied by the subscriber
  • YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.FLAT
    • param1: the first argument passed to fire. If you need to pass multiple parameters, use and array or object literal
    • param2: a custom object supplied by the subscriber

YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.LIST.description:
Subscriber listener sigature constant.  The LIST type returns three
parameters: the event type, the array of args passed to fire, and
the optional custom object

scope.description:
The scope the the event will fire from by default.  Defaults to the window 
obj

type.description: The type of event, returned to subscribers when the event fires

YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.description:
The CustomEvent class lets you define events for your application
that can be subscribed to by one or more independent component.

YAHOO.widget.Module.name: YAHOO.widget.Module

visible.description: Specifies whether the Module is visible on the page.

monitorresize.description:
Specifies whether to create a special proxy iframe to monitor 
for user font resizing in the document

effect.description:
Object or array of objects representing the ContainerEffect 
classes that are active for animating the container.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Module OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Module

params.name: userConfig
params.description:
The configuration Object literal containing 
the configuration that should be set for this module. See configuration 
documentation for more details.

constructors.description:
Module is a JavaScript representation of the Standard Module Format. 
Standard Module Format is a simple standard for markup containers where 
child nodes representing the header, body, and footer of the content are 
denoted using the CSS classes "hd", "bd", and "ft" respectively. 
Module is the base class for all other classes in the YUI 
Container package.

params.name: classRef
params.description:
class reference of the initializing 
class, such as this.beforeInitEvent.fire(Module)

YAHOO.widget.Module.textResizeEvent.description:
Singleton CustomEvent fired when the font size is changed in the browser.
Opera's "zoom" functionality currently does not support text 
size detection.

hideEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the Module is hidden

beforeHideEvent.description: CustomEvent fired before the Module is hidden

params.name: content
params.description:
String/element representing 
the new body content

changeBodyEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the body content of the Module is modified

beforeRenderEvent.description: CustomEvent fired before the Module is rendered

changeContentEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the content of the Module is modified

beforeShowEvent.description: CustomEvent fired before the Module is shown

params.name: content
params.description:
String/element representing 
the new footer content

changeFooterEvent.description:
CustomEvent fired when the footer content of the Module 
is modified

renderEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the Module is rendered

showEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the Module is shown

params.description:
class reference of the initializing 
class, such as this.beforeInitEvent.fire(Module)

params.description:
String/element representing 
the new header content

CustomEvent fired when the header content of the Module 
is modified

destroyEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the Module is destroyed

The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration 
handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

The scope object. For configuration handlers, 
this will usually equal the owner.

configMonitorResize.description: Default event handler for the "monitorresize" configuration property

Appends the passed element to the header. If no header is present, 
one will be automatically created.

params.name: bodyContent
params.description: The HTMLElement to append to the body

setBody.description:
Sets the Module's body content to the HTML specified, or appends the
passed element to the body. If no body is present, one will be 
automatically created.

hide.description:
Hides the Module element by setting the visible configuration 
property to false. Also fires two events: beforeHideEvent prior to 
the visibility change, and hideEvent after.

return.description: Success or failure of the render

params.name: appendToNode
params.description: The element id to which the Module should be appended to prior to rendering OR

params.name: appendToNode
params.description:
The element to which the Module 
should be appended to prior to rendering

params.name: moduleElement
params.description:
OPTIONAL. The element that 
represents the actual Standard Module container.

render.description:
Renders the Module by inserting the elements that are not already 
in the main Module into their correct places. Optionally appends 
the Module to the specified node prior to the render's execution. 
NOTE: For Modules without existing markup, the appendToNode argument 
is REQUIRED. If this argument is ommitted and the current element is 
not present in the document, the function will return false, 
indicating that the render was a failure.

params.name: e
params.description: The DOM resize event

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object passed to the handler

onDomResize.description: Event handler fired when the resize monitor element is resized.

automatically at appropriate times by the Module class.

the footer

Sets the Module's footer content to the HTML specified, or appends 
the passed element to the footer. If no footer is present, one will 
be automatically created.

initResizeMonitor.description:
Initialized an empty IFRAME that is placed out of the visible area 
that can be used to detect text resize.

Appends the passed element to the body. If no body is present, one 
will be automatically created.

params.name: element

appendToFooter.description:
Appends the passed element to the footer. If no footer is present, 
one will be automatically created.

params.name: type

The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration 
handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

this will usually equal the owner.

configVisible.description:
Default event handler for changing the visibility property of a 
Module. By default, this is achieved by switching the "display" style 
between "block" and "none".
This method is responsible for firing showEvent and hideEvent.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Module OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Module

params.description:
The configuration Object literal 
containing the configuration that should be set for this module. 
See configuration documentation for more details.

init.description:
The Module class's initialization method, which is executed for
Module and all of its subclasses. This method is automatically 
called by the constructor, and  sets up all DOM references for 
pre-existing markup, and creates required markup if it is not 
already present.

return.description: The string representation of the Module

toString.description: Returns a String representation of the Object.

Initializes the custom events for Module which are fired 
automatically at appropriate times by the Module class.

show.description:
Shows the Module element by setting the visible configuration 
property to true. Also fires two events: beforeShowEvent prior to 
the visibility change, and showEvent after.

destroy.description:
Removes the Module element from the DOM and sets all child elements 
to null.

params.description:
The HTMLElement to append to 
the header

Sets the Module's header content to the HTML specified, or appends 
the passed element to the header. If no header is present, one will 
be automatically created.

body.description: The body element, denoted with CSS class "bd"

isSecure.description:
Boolean representing whether or not the current browsing context is 
secure (https)

element.description: The main module element that contains the header, body, and footer

YAHOO.widget.Module.description:
Module is a JavaScript representation of the Standard Module Format. 
Standard Module Format is a simple standard for markup containers where 
child nodes representing the header, body, and footer of the content are 
denoted using the CSS classes "hd", "bd", and "ft" respectively. 
Module is the base class for all other classes in the YUI 
Container package.

YAHOO.lang.description: Provides the language utilites and extensions used by the library

return.description: Boolean

params.name: o
params.description: The object being testing

isArray.description:
Determines whether or not the provided object is an array.
Testing typeof/instanceof/constructor of arrays across frame 
boundaries isn't possible in Safari unless you have a reference
to the other frame to test against its Array prototype.  To
handle this case, we test well-known array properties instead.
properties.

return.description: the trimmed string

trim.description:
Returns a string without any leading or trailing whitespace.  If 
the input is not a string, the input will be returned untouched.

params.name: s
params.description: the string to trim

return.description: Boolean

params.name: o
params.description: The object being testing

isString.description: Determines whether or not the provided object is a string

return.description: Boolean

params.name: o
params.description: The object being testing

isBoolean.description: Determines whether or not the provided object is a boolean

params.name: subc
params.description: the object to modify

params.name: superc
params.description: the object to inherit

params.name: overrides
params.description:
additional properties/methods to add to the
subclass prototype.  These will override the
matching items obtained from the superclass 
if present.

extend.description:
Utility to set up the prototype, constructor and superclass properties to
support an inheritance strategy that can chain constructors and methods.
Static members will not be inherited.

return.description: the new merged object

merge.description:
Returns a new object containing all of the properties of
all the supplied objects.  The properties from later objects
will overwrite those in earlier objects.

params.name: arguments
params.description: the objects to merge

augmentObject.description:
Applies all properties in the supplier to the receiver if the
receiver does not have these properties yet.  Optionally, one or 
more methods/properties can be specified (as additional 
parameters).  This option will overwrite the property if receiver 
has it already.  If true is passed as the third parameter, all 
properties will be applied and _will_ overwrite properties in 
the receiver.

params.name: r
params.description: the object to receive the augmentation

params.name: s
params.description: the object that supplies the properties to augment

params.name: arguments
params.description:
zero or more properties methods 
to augment the receiver with.  If none specified, everything
in the supplier will be used unless it would
overwrite an existing property in the receiver. If true
is specified as the third parameter, all properties will
be applied and will overwrite an existing property in
the receiver

return.description: the substituted string

substitute.description:
Does variable substitution on a string. It scans through the string 
looking for expressions enclosed in { } braces. If an expression 
is found, it is used a key on the object.  If there is a space in
the key, the first word is used for the key and the rest is provided
to an optional function to be used to programatically determine the
value (the extra information might be used for this decision). If 
the value for the key in the object, or what is returned from the
function has a string value, number value, or object value, it is 
substituted for the bracket expression and it repeats.  If this
value is an object, it uses the Object's toString() if this has
been overridden, otherwise it does a shallow dump of the key/value
pairs.

params.name: s
params.description: The string that will be modified.

params.name: o
params.description: An object containing the replacement values

params.name: f
params.description:
An optional function that can be used to
process each match.  It receives the key,
value, and any extra metadata included with
the key inside of the braces.

return.description: Boolean

params.name: o
params.description: The object being testing

isNull.description: Determines whether or not the provided object is null

return.description: true if it is not null/undefined/NaN || false

isValue.description:
A convenience method for detecting a legitimate non-null value.
Returns false for null/undefined/NaN, true for other values, 
including 0/false/''

params.name: o
params.description: the item to test

return.description: Boolean

params.name: o
params.description: The object being testing

hasOwnProperty.description:
Determines whether or not the property was added to the object instance. Returns false if the property is not present in the object, or was inherited from the prototype. This abstraction is provided to enable hasOwnProperty for Safari 1.3.x. There is a discrepancy between YAHOO.lang.hasOwnProperty and Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty when the property is a primitive added to both the instance AND prototype with the same value: 
var A = function() {};
A.prototype.foo = 'foo';
var a = new A();
a.foo = 'foo';
alert(a.hasOwnProperty('foo')); // true
alert(YAHOO.lang.hasOwnProperty(a, 'foo')); // false when using fallback

augment.description:
Same as YAHOO.lang.augmentObject, except it only applies prototype 
properties.  This is an alias for augmentProto.

params.name: r
params.description: the object to receive the augmentation

params.name: s
params.description: the object that supplies the properties to augment

params.name: arguments
params.description:
zero or more properties methods to 
augment the receiver with.  If none specified, everything
in the supplier will be used unless it would
overwrite an existing property in the receiver.  if true
is specified as the third parameter, all properties will
be applied and will overwrite an existing property in
the receiver

augmentProto.description: Same as YAHOO.lang.augmentObject, except it only applies prototype properties

params.name: r
params.description: the object to receive the augmentation

params.name: s
params.description: the object that supplies the properties to augment

params.name: arguments
params.description:
zero or more properties methods 
to augment the receiver with.  If none specified, everything 
in the supplier will be used unless it would overwrite an existing 
property in the receiver.  if true is specified as the third 
parameter, all properties will be applied and will overwrite an 
existing property in the receiver

return.description: Boolean

params.name: o
params.description: The object being testing

isFunction.description: Determines whether or not the provided object is a function

return.description: Boolean

params.name: o
params.description: The object being testing

isNumber.description: Determines whether or not the provided object is a legal number

return.description: Boolean

params.name: o
params.description: The object being testing

isObject.description:
Determines whether or not the provided object is of type object
or function

return.description: the dump result

dump.description:
Returns a simple string representation of the object or array.
Other types of objects will be returned unprocessed.  Arrays
are expected to be indexed.  Use object notation for
associative arrays.

params.name: o
params.description: The object to dump

params.name: d
params.description: How deep to recurse child objects, default 3

return.description: Boolean

params.name: o
params.description: The object being testing

isUndefined.description: Determines whether or not the provided object is undefined

_IEEnumFix.description:
IE will not enumerate native functions in a derived object even if the
function was overridden.  This is a workaround for specific functions 
we care about on the Object prototype.
_IEEnumFix.param: {Function} r  the object to receive the augmentation

initializeTable.description:
Resets a RecordSet with the given data and populates the page view
with the new data. Any previous data and selection states are cleared.
However, sort states are not cleared, so if the given data is in a particular
sort order, implementers should take care to reset the sortedBy property. If
pagination is enabled, the currentPage is shown and Paginator UI updated,
otherwise all rows are displayed as a single page. For performance, existing
DOM elements are reused when possible.

destroy.description:
Nulls out the entire DataTable instance and related objects, removes attached
event listeners, and clears out DOM elements inside the container. After
calling this method, the instance reference should be expliclitly nulled by
implementer, as in myDataTable = null. Use with caution!

paginator.default:
{ containers:[], // UI container elements
rowsPerPage:500, // 500 rows
currentPage:1, // page one
pageLinks:0, // show all links
pageLinksStart:1, // first link is page 1
dropdownOptions:null, // no dropdown
links: [], // links elements
dropdowns: [] } //dropdown elements

scrollable.description:
True if primary TBODY should scroll while THEAD remains fixed.
When enabling this feature, captions cannot be used, and the following
features are not recommended: inline editing, resizeable columns.

paginated.description: True if built-in client-side pagination is enabled

sortedBy.description:
Object literal provides metadata for initial sort values if
data will arrive pre-sorted:
<dl>
<dt>sortedBy.key</dt>
<dd>Key of sorted Column</dd>
<dt>sortedBy.dir</dt>
<dd>Initial sort direction, either "asc" or "desc"</dd>
</dl>

initialRequest.description: Defines the initial request that gets sent to the DataSource.

selectionMode.description:
Specifies row or cell selection mode. Accepts the following strings:
<dl>
<dt>"standard"</dt>
<dd>Standard row selection with support for modifier keys to enable
multiple selections.</dd>
<dt>"single"</dt>
<dd>Row selection with modifier keys disabled to not allow
multiple selections.</dd>
<dt>"singlecell"</dt>
<dd>Cell selection with modifier keys disabled to not allow
multiple selections.</dd>
<dt>"cellblock"</dt>
<dd>Cell selection with support for modifier keys to enable multiple
selections in a block-fashion, like a spreadsheet.</dd>
<dt>"cellrange"</dt>
<dd>Cell selection with support for modifier keys to enable multiple
selections in a range-fashion, like a calendar.</dd>
</dl>

YAHOO.util.ColorAnim.name: YAHOO.util.ColorAnim

params.name: el
params.description: Reference to the element that will be animated

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attribute(s) to be animated.
Each attribute is an object with at minimum a "to" or "by" member defined.
Additional optional members are "from" (defaults to current value), "units" (defaults to "px").
All attribute names use camelCase.

params.name: duration
params.description: (optional, defaults to 1 second) Length of animation (frames or seconds), defaults to time-based

params.name: method
params.description: (optional, defaults to YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone) Computes the values that are applied to the attributes per frame (generally a YAHOO.util.Easing method)

constructors.description:
Anim subclass for color transitions.

Usage: var myAnim = new Y.ColorAnim(el, { backgroundColor: { from: '#FF0000', to: '#FFFFFF' } }, 1, Y.Easing.easeOut); Color values can be specified with either 112233, #112233, [255,255,255], or rgb(255,255,255)

return.description: The 3-tuple of rgb values.

params.name: s
params.description: The string to parse.

parseColor.description: Attempts to parse the given string and return a 3-tuple.

YAHOO.util.ColorAnim.description:
Anim subclass for color transitions.

Usage: var myAnim = new Y.ColorAnim(el, { backgroundColor: { from: '#FF0000', to: '#FFFFFF' } }, 1, Y.Easing.easeOut); Color values can be specified with either 112233, #112233, [255,255,255], or rgb(255,255,255)

YAHOO.util.DDProxy.name: YAHOO.util.DDProxy

params.name: id
params.description: the id of the linked html element

params.name: sGroup
params.description: the group of related DragDrop objects

params.name: config
params.description:
an object containing configurable attributes
Valid properties for DDProxy in addition to those in DragDrop: 
resizeFrame, centerFrame, dragElId

constructors.description:
A DragDrop implementation that inserts an empty, bordered div into
the document that follows the cursor during drag operations.  At the time of
the click, the frame div is resized to the dimensions of the linked html
element, and moved to the exact location of the linked element.
References to the "frame" element refer to the single proxy element that
was created to be dragged in place of all DDProxy elements on the
page.

createFrame.description: Creates the proxy element if it does not yet exist

initFrame.description:
Initialization for the drag frame element.  Must be called in the
constructor of all subclasses

_resizeProxy.description:
The proxy is automatically resized to the dimensions of the linked
element when a drag is initiated, unless resizeFrame is set to false

params.name: iPageX
params.description: X click position

params.name: iPageY
params.description: Y click position

showFrame.description:
Resizes the drag frame to the dimensions of the clicked object, positions 
it over the object, and finally displays it

YAHOO.util.DDProxy.dragElId.description: The default drag frame div id

resizeFrame.description:
By default we resize the drag frame to be the same size as the element
we want to drag (this is to get the frame effect).  We can turn it off
if we want a different behavior.

centerFrame.description:
By default the frame is positioned exactly where the drag element is, so
we use the cursor offset provided by YAHOO.util.DD.  Another option that works only if
you do not have constraints on the obj is to have the drag frame centered
around the cursor.  Set centerFrame to true for this effect.

YAHOO.util.DDProxy.description:
A DragDrop implementation that inserts an empty, bordered div into
the document that follows the cursor during drag operations.  At the time of
the click, the frame div is resized to the dimensions of the linked html
element, and moved to the exact location of the linked element.
References to the "frame" element refer to the single proxy element that
was created to be dragged in place of all DDProxy elements on the
page.

that has a string propery called label.  By default, the clicking the

overridden to provide a custom presentation for a specific node.

has a property called "label" that we will use.

YAHOO.widget.MenuItem.name: YAHOO.widget.MenuItem

submenu.description:
Object specifying the submenu to be appended to the menu item. The value can be one of the following:
  • Object specifying a Menu instance.
  • Object literal specifying the menu to be created. Format: { id: [menu id], itemdata: [array of values for items] }.
  • String specifying the id attribute of the <div> element of the menu.
  • Object specifying the <div> element of the menu.

classname.description: CSS class to be applied to the menu item's root <li> element. The specified class(es) are appended in addition to the default class as specified by the menu item's CSS_CLASS_NAME constant.

checked.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu item should be rendered 
with a checkmark.

target.description: String specifying the value for the "target" attribute of the menu item's anchor element. Specifying a target will require the user to click directly on the menu item's anchor node in order to cause the browser to navigate to the specified URL. When building a menu from existing HTML the value of this property will be interpreted from the menu's markup.

url.description:
String specifying the URL for the menu item's anchor's 
"href" attribute.  When building a menu from existing HTML the value 
of this property will be interpreted from the menu's markup.

text.description:
String specifying the text label for the menu item.  
When building a menu from existing HTML the value of this property
will be interpreted from the menu's markup.

selected.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu item should 
be highlighted.

strongemphasis.description:
Boolean indicating if the text of the menu item will be 
rendered with strong emphasis.

disabled.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu item should be disabled.  
(Disabled menu items are  dimmed and will not respond to user input 
or fire events.)

emphasis.deprecated: Use "text" configuration property to add emphasis. For example: oMenuItem.cfg.setProperty("text", "<em>Some Text</em<");
emphasis.description:
Boolean indicating if the text of the menu item will be 
rendered with emphasis.

helptext.deprecated: Use "text" configuration property to add help text markup. For example: oMenuItem.cfg.setProperty("text", "Copy <em class=\"helptext\">Ctrl + C</em<");
helptext.description:
String specifying additional instructional text to 
accompany the text for the menu item.

onclick.description:
Object literal representing the code to be executed when the item is clicked. Format:
{
fn: Function, // The handler to call when the event fires.
obj: Object, // An object to pass back to the handler.
scope: Object // The object to use for the scope of the handler.

YAHOO.util.EventProvider.name: YAHOO.util.EventProvider

params.name: p_type
params.description: The type, or name of the event

unsubscribeAll.description:
Removes all listeners from the specified event.  If the event type
is not specified, all listeners from all hosted custom events will
be removed.

params.name: p_type
params.description: the type, or name of the event

params.name: p_fn
params.description: the function to exectute when the event fires

params.name: p_obj
params.description:
An object to be passed along when the event 
fires

params.name: p_override
params.description:
If true, the obj passed in becomes the 
execution scope of the listener

subscribe.description: Subscribe to a CustomEvent by event type

return.description: true if the subscriber was found and detached.

params.name: p_type
params.description:
The type, or name of the event.  If the type
is not specified, it will attempt to remove
the listener from all hosted events.

params.name: p_fn
params.description:
The subscribed function to unsubscribe, if not
supplied, all subscribers will be removed.

params.name: p_obj
params.description:
The custom object passed to subscribe.  This is
optional, but if supplied will be used to
disambiguate multiple listeners that are the same
(e.g., you subscribe many object using a function
that lives on the prototype)

unsubscribe.description: Unsubscribes one or more listeners the from the specified event

params.name: type
params.description: the type, or name of the event

hasEvent.description:
Returns true if the custom event of the provided type has been created
with createEvent.

return.description: the return value from CustomEvent.fire

params.name: p_type
params.description: the type, or name of the event

params.name: arguments
params.description:
an arbitrary set of parameters to pass to 
the handler.

fireEvent.description:
Fire a custom event by name. The callback functions will be executed from the scope specified when the event was created, and with the following parameters:
  • The first argument fire() was executed with
  • The custom object (if any) that was passed into the subscribe() method
If the custom event has not been explicitly created, it will be created now with the default config, scoped to the host object

return.description: the custom event

params.name: p_type
params.description: the type, or name of the event

params.name: p_config
params.description:
optional config params. Valid properties are:
  • scope: defines the default execution scope. If not defined the default scope will be this instance.
  • silent: if true, the custom event will not generate log messages. This is false by default.
  • onSubscribeCallback: specifies a callback to execute when the event has a new subscriber. This will fire immediately for each queued subscriber if any exist prior to the creation of the event.

createEvent.description:
Creates a new custom event of the specified type.  If a custom event
by that name already exists, it will not be re-created.  In either
case the custom event is returned.

__yui_subscribers.description: Private storage of custom event subscribers

YAHOO.util.EventProvider.description:
EventProvider is designed to be used with YAHOO.augment to wrap 
CustomEvents in an interface that allows events to be subscribed to 
and fired by name.  This makes it possible for implementing code to
subscribe to an event that either has not been created yet, or will
not be created at all.

YAHOO.widget.DataSource.name: YAHOO.widget.DataSource

constructors.description:
The DataSource classes manages sending a request and returning response from a live
database. Supported data include local JavaScript arrays and objects and databases
accessible via XHR connections. Supported response formats include JavaScript arrays,
JSON, XML, and flat-file textual data.

params.name: oSelf
params.description: The DataSource instance.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The requesting object.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: The query string.

params.name: sMsg
params.description: Error message string

dataErrorEvent.description: Fired when an error is encountered with the live data source.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The requesting object.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: The query string.

params.name: aResults
params.description: Array of result objects.

getCachedResultsEvent.description: Fired when data is retrieved from the local cache.

params.description: The DataSource instance.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The requesting object.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: The query string.

cacheQueryEvent.description: Fired when a query is made to the local cache.

params.name: oSelf
params.description: The DataSource instance.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The requesting object.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: The query string.

queryEvent.description: Fired when a query is made to the live data source.

params.name: oSelf
params.description: The DataSource instance

cacheFlushEvent.description: Fired when the local cache is flushed.

params.name: oSelf
params.description: The DataSource instance.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The requesting object.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: The query string.

params.name: aResults
params.description: Array of result objects.

getResultsEvent.description: Fired when data is retrieved from the live data source.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function defined by oParent object to which to return results.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: Query string.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

getResults.description:
Retrieves query results, first checking the local cache, then making the
query request to the live data source as defined by the function doQuery.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function implemented by oParent to which to return results.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: Query string.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

doQuery.description:
Abstract method implemented by subclasses to make a query to the live data
source. Must call the callback function with the response returned from the
query. Populates cache (if enabled).

return.description: Unique name of the DataSource instance

toString.description: Public accessor to the unique name of the DataSource instance.

return.description: aResults  Array of results from local cache if found, otherwise null.

_doQueryCache.description:
Queries the local cache for results. If query has been cached, the callback
function is called with the results, and the cached is refreshed so that it
is now the newest element.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function defined by oParent object to which to return results.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: Query string.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

params.name: oResult
params.description: Data result object, including array of results.

_addCacheElem.description:
Adds a result object to the local cache, evicting the oldest element if the 
cache is full. Newer items will have higher indexes, the oldest item will have
index of 0.

_nIndex.description: Internal class variable to index multiple DataSource instances.

maxCacheEntries.description:
Max size of the local cache.  Set to 0 to turn off caching.  Caching is
useful to reduce the number of server connections.  Recommended only for data
sources that return comprehensive results for queries or when stale data is
not an issue.

queryMatchSubset.description:
Enables query subset matching. If caching is on and queryMatchSubset is
true, substrings of queries will return matching cached results. For
instance, if the first query is for "abc" susequent queries that start with
"abc", like "abcd", will be queried against the cache, and not the live data
source. Recommended only for DataSources that return comprehensive results
for queries with very few characters.

_aCache.description: Local cache of data result objects indexed chronologically.

ERROR_DATANULL.description: Error message for null data responses.

queryMatchCase.description:
Enables case-sensitivity in the matching algorithm used against JS Array
types of DataSources and DataSource caches. If queryMatchCase is true, only
case-sensitive matches will return.

queryMatchContains.description:
Use this to fine-tune the matching algorithm used against JS Array types of
DataSource and DataSource caches. If queryMatchContains is true, then the JS
Array or cache returns results that "contain" the query string. By default,
queryMatchContains is set to false, so that only results that "start with"
the query string are returned.

ERROR_DATAPARSE.description: Error message for data responses with parsing errors.

YAHOO.widget.DataSource.description:
The DataSource classes manages sending a request and returning response from a live
database. Supported data include local JavaScript arrays and objects and databases
accessible via XHR connections. Supported response formats include JavaScript arrays,
JSON, XML, and flat-file textual data.

YAHOO.widget.DS_XHR.name: YAHOO.widget.DS_XHR

params.name: sScriptURI
params.description:
Absolute or relative URI to script that returns query
results as JSON, XML, or delimited flat-file data.

params.name: aSchema
params.description: Data schema definition of results.

params.name: oConfigs
params.description: (optional) Object literal of config params.

constructors.description:
Implementation of YAHOO.widget.DataSource using XML HTTP requests that return
query results.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: Query string.

params.name: oResponse
params.description: The raw response data to parse.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

parseResponse.description:
Parses raw response data into an array of result objects. The result data key
is always stashed in the [0] element of each result object.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function defined by oParent object to which to return results.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: Query string.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

doQuery.description:
Queries the live data source defined by scriptURI for results. Results are
passed back to a callback function.

responseType.description:
XHR response data type. Other types that may be defined are YAHOO.widget.DS_XHR.TYPE_XML
and YAHOO.widget.DS_XHR.TYPE_FLAT.

scriptQueryAppend.description:
String of key/value pairs to append to requests made to scriptURI. Define
this string when you want to send additional query parameters to your script.
When defined, queries will be sent to
<scriptURI>?<scriptQueryParam>=userinput&<scriptQueryAppend>

responseStripAfter.description:
String after which to strip results. If the results from the XHR are sent
back as HTML, the gzip HTML comment appears at the end of the data and should
be ignored.

scriptURI.description:
Absolute or relative URI to script that returns query results. For instance,
queries will be sent to <scriptURI>?<scriptQueryParam>=userinput

connTimeout.description:
Number of milliseconds the XHR connection will wait for a server response. A
a value of zero indicates the XHR connection will wait forever. Any value
greater than zero will use the Connection utility's Auto-Abort feature.

scriptQueryParam.description:
Query string parameter name sent to scriptURI. For instance, queries will be
sent to <scriptURI>?<scriptQueryParam>=userinput

connMgr.description:
Alias to YUI Connection Manager. Allows implementers to specify their own
subclasses of the YUI Connection Manager utility.

YAHOO.widget.DS_XHR.description:
Implementation of YAHOO.widget.DataSource using XML HTTP requests that return
query results.

constructors.description: YAHOO.widget.CalendarGroup is a special container class for YAHOO.widget.Calendar. This class facilitates the ability to have multi-page calendar views that share a single dataset and are dependent on each other. The calendar group instance will refer to each of its elements using a 0-based index. For example, to construct the placeholder for a calendar group widget with id "cal1" and containerId of "cal1Container", the markup would be as follows: <div id="cal1Container_0"></div> <div id="cal1Container_1"></div> The tables for the calendars ("cal1_0" and "cal1_1") will be inserted into those containers.

beforeRenderEvent.description: Fired before the Calendar is rendered

beforeSelectEvent.description: Fired before a selection is made

resetEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar is reset

clearEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar is cleared

deselectCell will deselect the cell at the specified index on each displayed Calendar page.

params.description:
The date string of dates to select in the current calendar. Valid formats are
individual date(s) (12/24/2005,12/26/2005) or date range(s) (12/24/2005-1/1/2006).
Multiple comma-delimited dates can also be passed to this method (12/24/2005,12/11/2005-12/13/2005).
This method can also take a JavaScript Date object or an array of Date objects.

select.description:
Selects a date or a collection of dates on the current calendar. This method, by default,
does not call the render method explicitly. Once selection has completed, render must be 
called for the changes to be reflected visually.

_setMonthOnDate.description:
Sets the month on a Date object, taking into account year rollover if the month is less than 0 or greater than 11.
The Date object passed in is modified. It should be cloned before passing it into this method if the original value needs to be maintained

return.description: Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.

params.name: cellIndex
params.description: The index of the cell to be selected.

selectCell.description:
Selects dates in the CalendarGroup based on the cell index provided. This method is used to select cells without having to do a full render. The selected style is applied to the cells directly. The value of the MULTI_SELECT Configuration attribute will determine the set of dates which get selected.
  • If MULTI_SELECT is false, selectCell will select the cell at the specified index for only the last displayed Calendar page.
  • If MULTI_SELECT is true, selectCell will select the cell at the specified index, on each displayed Calendar page.

renderFooter.description:
Renders a footer for the 2-up calendar container. By default, this method is
unimplemented.

addRenderer.description:
Adds a renderer to the render stack. The function reference passed to this method will be executed
when a date cell matches the conditions specified in the date string for this renderer.

reset.description:
Resets the calendar widget to the originally selected month and year, and 
sets the calendar to the initial selection(s).

return.description:
Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.
Assuming that this function executes properly, the return value should be an empty array.
However, the empty array is returned for the sake of being able to check the selection status
of the calendar.

deselectAll.description: Deselects all dates on the current calendar.

Sets the calendar group's month explicitly. This month will be set into the first

to the current month and year.

constructors.description:
The AutoComplete class provides the customizable functionality of a plug-and-play DHTML auto completion widget. Some key features:
  • Navigate with up/down arrow keys and/or mouse to pick a selection
  • The drop down container can "roll down" or "fly out" via configurable animation
  • UI look-and-feel customizable through CSS, including container attributes, borders, position, fonts, etc

forceSelection.description:
Whether or not to force the user's selection to match one of the query
results. Enabling this feature essentially transforms the input field into a
<select> field. This feature is not recommended with delimiter character(s)
defined.

animHoriz.description:
Whether or not to animate the expansion/collapse of the results container in the
horizontal direction.

useShadow.description: Whether or not the results container should have a shadow.

useIFrame.description:
Whether or not to use an iFrame to layer over Windows form elements in
IE. Set to true only when the results container will be on top of a
<select> field in IE and thus exposed to the IE z-index bug (i.e.,
5.5 < IE < 7).

_iFrameSrc.description:
Src to iFrame used when useIFrame = true. Supports implementations over SSL
as well.

_queryInterval.description:
For users typing via certain IMEs, queries must be triggered by intervals,
since key events yet supported across all browsers for all IMEs.

_aListItems.description:
Array of <li> elements references that contain query results within the
results container.

_nKeyCode.description: Key code of the last key pressed in textbox.

typeAhead.description:
Whether or not the input field should be automatically updated
with the first query result as the user types, auto-selecting the substring
that the user has not typed.

_nDisplayedItems.description: Number of <li> elements currently displayed in results container.

_bOverContainer.description:
Whether or not the mouse is currently over the results
container. This is necessary in order to prevent clicks on container items
from being text input field blur events.

delimChar.description:
Query delimiter. A single character separator for multiple delimited
selections. Multiple delimiter characteres may be defined as an array of
strings. A null value or empty string indicates that query results cannot
be delimited. This feature is not recommended if you need forceSelection to
be true.

alwaysShowContainer.description:
Whether or not the results container should always be displayed.
Enabling this feature displays the container when the widget is instantiated
and prevents the toggling of the container to a collapsed state.

highlightClassName.description: Class name of a highlighted item within results container.

minQueryLength.description:
Number of characters that must be entered before querying for results. A negative value
effectively turns off the widget. A value of 0 allows queries of null or empty string
values.

prehighlightClassName.description: Class name of a pre-highlighted item within results container.

_maxResultsDisplayed.description: Internal count of <li> elements displayed and hidden in results container.

_sSavedQuery.description: Past queries this session (for saving delimited queries).

_bItemSelected.description:
Whether or not an item has been selected since the container was populated
with results. Reset to false by _populateList, and set to true when item is
selected.

dataSource.description:
The DataSource object that encapsulates the data used for auto completion.
This object should be an inherited object from YAHOO.widget.DataSource.

autoHighlight.description:
Whether or not the first item in results container should be automatically highlighted
on expand.

allowBrowserAutocomplete.description:
Whether or not to allow browsers to cache user-typed input in the input
field. Disabling this feature will prevent the widget from setting the
autocomplete="off" on the input field. When autocomplete="off"
and users click the back button after form submission, user-typed input can
be prefilled by the browser from its cache. This caching of user input may
not be desired for sensitive data, such as credit card numbers, in which
case, implementers should consider setting allowBrowserAutocomplete to false.

animVert.description:
Whether or not to animate the expansion/collapse of the results container in the
vertical direction.

_nIndex.description: Internal class variable to index multiple AutoComplete instances.

_bContainerOpen.description: Whether or not the results container is currently open.

animSpeed.description: Speed of container expand/collapse animation, in seconds..

_oCurItem.description: Pointer to the currently highlighted <li> element in the container.

maxResultsDisplayed.description: Maximum number of results to display in results container.

_bFocused.description:
Whether or not the input field is currently in focus. If query results come back
but the user has already moved on, do not proceed with auto complete behavior.

queryDelay.description:
Number of seconds to delay before submitting a query request.  If a query
request is received before a previous one has completed its delay, the
previous request is cancelled and the new request is set to the delay.
Implementers should take care when setting this value very low (i.e., less
than 0.2) with low latency DataSources and the typeAhead feature enabled, as
fast typers may see unexpected behavior.

YAHOO.widget.AutoComplete.description:
The AutoComplete class provides the customizable functionality of a plug-and-play DHTML auto completion widget. Some key features:
  • Navigate with up/down arrow keys and/or mouse to pick a selection
  • The drop down container can "roll down" or "fly out" via configurable animation
  • UI look-and-feel customizable through CSS, including container attributes, borders, position, fonts, etc

params.name: points
params.description: An array containing Bezier points

params.description: A number between 0 and 1 which is the basis for determining current position

getPosition.description:
Get the current position of the animated element based on t.
Each point is an array of "x" and "y" values (0 = x, 1 = y)
At least 2 points are required (start and end).
First point is start. Last point is end.
Additional control points are optional.

YAHOO.util.Bezier.description: Used to calculate Bezier splines for any number of control points.

YAHOO.widget.MenuBar.name: YAHOO.widget.MenuBar

position.description:
String indicating how a menu bar should be positioned on the 
screen.  Possible values are "static" and "dynamic."  Static menu bars 
are visible by default and reside in the normal flow of the document 
(CSS position: static).  Dynamic menu bars are hidden by default, reside
out of the normal flow of the document (CSS position: absolute), and can 
overlay other elements on the screen.

submenualignment.description:
Array defining how submenus should be aligned to their 
parent menu bar item. The format is: [itemCorner, submenuCorner].

autosubmenudisplay.description:

visible when the user mouses over the menu bar's items.

YAHOO.env.name: YAHOO.env

return.description: The version info

getVersion.description:
Returns the version data for the specified module:
<dl>
<dt>name:</dt>      <dd>The name of the module</dd>
<dt>version:</dt>   <dd>The version in use</dd>
<dt>build:</dt>     <dd>The build number in use</dd>
<dt>versions:</dt>  <dd>All versions that were registered</dd>
<dt>builds:</dt>    <dd>All builds that were registered.</dd>
<dt>mainClass:</dt> <dd>An object that was was stamped with the
current version and build. If 
mainClass.VERSION != version or mainClass.BUILD != build,
multiple versions of pieces of the library have been
loaded, potentially causing issues.</dd>
</dl>
