YAHOO.env.ua.name: YAHOO.env.ua

gecko.description:
Gecko engine revision number. Will evaluate to 1 if Gecko is detected but the revision could not be found. Other browsers will be 0. Example: 1.8 
Firefox 1.0.0.4: 1.7.8   <-- Reports 1.7
Firefox 1.5.0.9: 1.8.0.9 <-- Reports 1.8
Firefox 2.0.0.3: 1.8.1.3 <-- Reports 1.8
Firefox 3 alpha: 1.9a4   <-- Reports 1.9

ie.description: Internet Explorer version number or 0.  Example: 6

webkit.description:
AppleWebKit version. KHTML browsers that are not WebKit browsers will evaluate to 1, other browsers 0. Example: 418.9.1 
Safari 1.3.2 (312.6): 312.8.1 <-- Reports 312.8 -- currently the 
latest available for Mac OSX 10.3.
Safari 2.0.2:         416     <-- hasOwnProperty introduced
Safari 2.0.4:         418     <-- preventDefault fixed
Safari 2.0.4 (419.3): 418.9.1 <-- One version of Safari may run
different versions of webkit
Safari 2.0.4 (419.3): 419     <-- Current Safari release
Webkit 212 nightly:   522+    <-- Safari 3.0 (with native SVG) should
be higher than this
http://developer.apple.com/internet/safari/uamatrix.html

YAHOO.env.ua.description:
Do not fork for a browser if it can be avoided.  Use feature detection when
you can.  Use the user agent as a last resort.  YAHOO.env.ua stores a version
number for the browser engine, 0 otherwise.  This value may or may not map
to the version number of the browser using the engine.  The value is 
presented as a float so that it can easily be used for boolean evaluation 
as well as for looking for a particular range of versions.  Because of this, 
some of the granularity of the version info may be lost (e.g., Gecko 1.8.0.9 
reports 1.8).

YAHOO_config is not included as part of the library.  Instead it is an

YAHOO.widget.Dialog.name: YAHOO.widget.Dialog

buttons.description:
Array of object literals, each containing a set of properties defining a button to be appended into the Dialog's footer. Each button object in the buttons array can have three properties:
text:
The text that will display on the face of the button. Please note: As of version 2.3, the text can include HTML.
handler:
Can be either:
  1. A reference to a function that should fire when the button is clicked. (In this case scope of this function is always its Dialog instance.)
  2. An object literal representing the code to be executed when the button is clicked. Format:
    {
    fn: Function, // The handler to call when the event fires.
    obj: Object, // An object to pass back to the handler.
    scope: Object // The object to use for the scope of the handler.
    }
    Please note: this functionality was added in version 2.3.
isDefault:
An optional boolean value that specifies that a button should be highlighted and focused by default.

postmethod.description:
The method to use for posting the Dialog's form. Possible values 
are "async", "form", and "manual".

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Dialog OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Dialog

params.name: userConfig
params.description:
The configuration object literal containing 
the configuration that should be set for this Dialog. See configuration 
documentation for more details.

constructors.description:
Dialog is an implementation of Panel that can be used to submit form 
data. Built-in functionality for buttons with event handlers is included, 
and button sets can be build dynamically, or the preincluded ones for 
Submit/Cancel and OK/Cancel can be utilized. Forms can be processed in 3
ways -- via an asynchronous Connection utility call, a simple form 
POST or GET, or manually.

asyncSubmitEvent.description: CustomEvent fired prior to asynchronous submission

manualSubmitEvent.description: CustomEvent fired prior to manual submission

formSubmitEvent.description: CustomEvent fired prior to form-based submission

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description:
The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration 
handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description:
The scope object. For configuration handlers, 
this will usually equal the owner.

configButtons.description: The default event handler for the "buttons" configuration property

getButtons.description: Returns an array containing each of the Dialog's buttons, by default an array of HTML <BUTTON< elements. If the Dialog's buttons were created using the YAHOO.widget.Button class (via the inclusion of the optional Button dependancy on the page), an array of YAHOO.widget.Button instances is returned.

focusFirstButton.description:
Sets the focus to the first button created via the "buttons"
configuration property.

doSubmit.description: Submits the Dialog's form depending on the value of the "postmethod" configuration property. Please note: As of version 2.3 this method will automatically handle asyncronous file uploads should the Dialog instance's form contain <input type="file"> elements. If a Dialog instance will be handling asyncronous file uploads, its callback property will need to be setup with a upload handler rather than the standard success and, or failure handlers. For more information, see the Connection Manager documenation on file uploads.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args

The CustomEvent arguments. For 
configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value 
for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description:
The scope object. For configuration handlers, 
this will usually equal the owner.

configClose.description:
The default event handler fired when the "close" property is 
changed. The method controls the appending or hiding of the close
icon at the top right of the Dialog.

initEvents.description:
Initializes the custom events for Dialog which are fired 
automatically at appropriate times by the Dialog class.

focusFirst.description:
Sets focus to the first element in the Dialog's form or the first 
button defined via the "buttons" configuration property. Called 
when the Dialog is made visible.

focusLastButton.description:
Sets the focus to the last button created via the "buttons" 
configuration property.

return.description:
A JSON object reprsenting the data of the 
current form.

getData.description:
Returns a JSON-compatible data structure representing the data 
currently contained in the form.

submit.description:
Executes a submit of the Dialog followed by a hide, if validation 
is successful.

focusLast.description:
Sets focus to the last element in the Dialog's form or the last 
button defined via the "buttons" configuration property.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Dialog OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Dialog

params.name: userConfig
params.description:
The configuration object literal 
containing the configuration that should be set for this Dialog. 
See configuration documentation for more details.

init.description:
The Dialog initialization method, which is executed for Dialog and 
all of its subclasses. This method is automatically called by the 
constructor, and  sets up all DOM references for pre-existing markup, 
and creates required markup if it is not already present.

return.description: The string representation of the Dialog

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the object.

destroy.description:
Removes the Panel element from the DOM and sets all child elements 
to null.

cancel.description: Executes the cancel of the Dialog followed by a hide.

focusDefaultButton.description:
Sets the focus to the button that is designated as the default via 
the "buttons" configuration property. By default, this method is 
called when the Dialog is made visible.

validate.description:
Built-in function hook for writing a validation function that will 
be checked for a "true" value prior to a submit. This function, as 
implemented by default, always returns true, so it should be 
overridden if validation is necessary.

Blurs all the buttons defined via the "buttons"

addModule.description:
Add a new module to the component metadata.  The javascript 
component must also use YAHOO.register to notify the loader 
when it has been loaded, or a verifier function must be
provided
<dl>
<dt>name:</dt>       <dd>required, the component name</dd>
<dt>type:</dt>       <dd>required, the component type (js or css)</dd>
<dt>path:</dt>       <dd>required, the path to the script from "base"</dd>
<dt>requires:</dt>   <dd>the modules required by this component</dd>
<dt>optional:</dt>   <dd>the optional modules for this component</dd>
<dt>supersedes:</dt> <dd>the modules this component replaces</dd>
<dt>rollup:</dt>     <dd>the number of superseded modules required for automatic rollup</dd>
<dt>verifier:</dt>   <dd>a function that is executed to determine when the module is fully loaded</dd>
<dt>fullpath:</dt>   <dd>If fullpath is specified, this is used instead of the configured base + path</dd>
<dt>skinnable:</dt>  <dd>flag to determine if skin assets should automatically be pulled in</dd>
</dl>

_reduce.description:
Remove superceded modules and loaded modules.  Called by
calculate() after we have the mega list of all dependencies

optional the name of the module that has
been loaded (which is usually why it is time to load the next

loadNext.description:
Executed every time a module is loaded, and if we are in a load
cycle, we attempt to load the next script.  Public so that it
is possible to call this if using a method other than
YAHOO.register to determine when scripts are fully loaded

Returns the skin module name for the specified skin name.  If a

Look for rollup packages to determine if all of the modules a
rollup supersedes are required.  If so, include the rollup to
help reduce the total number of connections required.  Called
by calculate()

Create a sandbox rather than inserting into lib into.

Flag to indicate the dependency tree needs to be recomputed

Set when beginning to compute the dependency tree.

with what has been loaded by the tool

All of the derived dependencies in sorted order, which
will be populated when either calculate() or insert()
is called

inserted.description: List of modules inserted by the utility

disabled.description:
This will toggle the editor's disabled state. When the editor is disabled, designMode is turned off and a mask is placed over the iframe so no interaction can take place.
All Toolbar buttons are also disabled so they cannot be used.

handleSubmit.description:
Config handles if the editor will attach itself to the textareas parent form's submit handler.
If it is set to true, the editor will attempt to attach a submit listener to the textareas parent form.
Then it will trigger the editors save handler and place the new content back into the text area before the form is submitted.

_createCurrentElement.description: This is a work around for the various browser issues with execCommand. This method will run execCommand('fontname', false, 'yui-tmp') on the given selection. It will then search the document for a span with the font-family set to yui-tmp and replace that with another span that has other information in it, then assign the new span to this.currentElement, so we now have an element reference to the element that was just modified. At this point we can use standard DOM manipulation to change it as we see fit.

YAHOO.widget.Editor.description: The Rich Text Editor is a UI control that replaces a standard HTML textarea; it allows for the rich formatting of text content, including common structural treatments like lists, formatting treatments like bold and italic text, and drag-and-drop inclusion and sizing of images. The Rich Text Editor's toolbar is extensible via a plugin architecture so that advanced implementations can achieve a high degree of customization.

YAHOO.util.DragDrop.name: YAHOO.util.DragDrop

params.name: id
params.description: of the element that is linked to this instance

params.name: sGroup
params.description: the group of related DragDrop objects

params.name: config
params.description:
an object containing configurable attributes
Valid properties for DragDrop: 
padding, isTarget, maintainOffset, primaryButtonOnly,

constructors.description:
Defines the interface and base operation of items that that can be dragged or can be drop targets. It was designed to be extended, overriding the event handlers for startDrag, onDrag, onDragOver, onDragOut. Up to three html elements can be associated with a DragDrop instance:
  • linked element: the element that is passed into the constructor. This is the element which defines the boundaries for interaction with other DragDrop objects.
  • handle element(s): The drag operation only occurs if the element that was clicked matches a handle element. By default this is the linked element, but there are times that you will want only a portion of the linked element to initiate the drag operation, and the setHandleElId() method provides a way to define this.
  • drag element: this represents an the element that would be moved along with the cursor during a drag operation. By default, this is the linked element itself as in {@link YAHOO.util.DD}. setDragElId() lets you define a separate element that would be moved, as in {@link YAHOO.util.DDProxy}
This class should not be instantiated until the onload event to ensure that the associated elements are available. The following would define a DragDrop obj that would interact with any other DragDrop obj in the "group1" group: 
dd = new YAHOO.util.DragDrop("div1", "group1");
Since none of the event handlers have been implemented, nothing would actually happen if you were to run the code above. Normally you would override this class or one of the default implementations, but you can also override the methods you want on an instance of the class... 
dd.onDragDrop = function(e, id) {
  alert("dd was dropped on " + id);
}

setPadding.description:
Configures the padding for the target zone in px.  Effectively expands
(or reduces) the virtual object size for targeting calculations.  
Supports css-style shorthand; if only one parameter is passed, all sides
will have that padding, and if only two are passed, the top and bottom
will have the first param, the left and right the second.

Property that is assigned to a drag and drop object when testing to
see if it is being targeted by another dd object.  This is a region
that represents the area the draggable element overlaps this target.
DDM.getBestMatch uses this property to compare the size of the overlap
to that of other targets in order to determine the closest match in
INTERSECT mode when multiple targets are part of the same interaction.

the mouse interaction.  DDM.getBestMatch uses this property first to
determine the closest match in INTERSECT mode when multiple targets
are part of the same interaction.

constrainY.description: Set to true when vertical contraints are applied

constrainX.description: Set to true when horizontal contraints are applied

xTicks.description:
Array of pixel locations the element will snap to if we specified a 
horizontal graduation/interval.  This array is generated automatically
when you define a tick interval.

groups.description:
The group defines a logical collection of DragDrop objects that are 
related.  Instances only get events when interacting with other 
DragDrop object in the same group.  This lets us define multiple 
groups using a single DragDrop subclass if we want.

locked.description:
Individual drag/drop instances can be locked.  This will prevent 
onmousedown start drag.

handleElId.description:
the id of the element that initiates the drag operation.  By default 
this is the linked element, but could be changed to be a child of this
element.  This lets us do things like only starting the drag when the 
header element within the linked html element is clicked.

maintainOffset.description:
Maintain offsets when we resetconstraints.  Set to true when you want
the position of the element relative to its parent to stay the same
when the page changes

primaryButtonOnly.description:
By default the drag and drop instance will only respond to the primary
button click (left button for a right-handed mouse).  Set to true to
allow drag and drop to start with any mouse click that is propogated
by the browser

YAHOO.util.DragDrop.description:
Defines the interface and base operation of items that that can be dragged or can be drop targets. It was designed to be extended, overriding the event handlers for startDrag, onDrag, onDragOver, onDragOut. Up to three html elements can be associated with a DragDrop instance:
  • linked element: the element that is passed into the constructor. This is the element which defines the boundaries for interaction with other DragDrop objects.
  • handle element(s): The drag operation only occurs if the element that was clicked matches a handle element. By default this is the linked element, but there are times that you will want only a portion of the linked element to initiate the drag operation, and the setHandleElId() method provides a way to define this.
  • drag element: this represents an the element that would be moved along with the cursor during a drag operation. By default, this is the linked element itself as in {@link YAHOO.util.DD}. setDragElId() lets you define a separate element that would be moved, as in {@link YAHOO.util.DDProxy}
This class should not be instantiated until the onload event to ensure that the associated elements are available. The following would define a DragDrop obj that would interact with any other DragDrop obj in the "group1" group: 
dd = new YAHOO.util.DragDrop("div1", "group1");
Since none of the event handlers have been implemented, nothing would actually happen if you were to run the code above. Normally you would override this class or one of the default implementations, but you can also override the methods you want on an instance of the class... 
dd.onDragDrop = function(e, id) {
  alert("dd was dropped on " + id);
}

YAHOO.name: YAHOO
YAHOO.description:
The YAHOO global namespace object.  If YAHOO is already defined, the
existing YAHOO object will not be overwritten so that defined
namespaces are preserved.

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the module (event, slider, etc)

params.name: mainClass
params.description:
a reference to class in the module.  This
class will be tagged with the version info
so that it will be possible to identify the
version that is in use when multiple versions
have loaded

params.name: data
params.description:
metadata object for the module.  Currently it
is expected to contain a "version" property
and a "build" property at minimum.

register.description: Registers a module with the YAHOO object

return.description: A reference to the last namespace object created

namespace.description:
Returns the namespace specified and creates it if it doesn't exist 
YAHOO.namespace("property.package");
YAHOO.namespace("YAHOO.property.package");
Either of the above would create YAHOO.property, then YAHOO.property.package Be careful when naming packages. Reserved words may work in some browsers and not others. For instance, the following will fail in Safari: 
YAHOO.namespace("really.long.nested.namespace");
This fails because "long" is a future reserved word in ECMAScript

params.name: arguments
params.description: 1-n namespaces to create

params.name: subc
params.description: the object to modify

params.name: superc
params.description: the object to inherit

params.name: overrides
params.description:
additional properties/methods to add to the
subclass prototype.  These will override the
matching items obtained from the superclass if present.

params.name: r
params.description: the object to receive the augmentation

params.name: s
params.description: the object that supplies the properties to augment

params.name: arguments
params.description:
zero or more properties methods to 
augment the receiver with.  If none specified, everything
in the supplier will be used unless it would
overwrite an existing property in the receiver

return.description: True if the log operation was successful.

log.description:
Uses YAHOO.widget.Logger to output a log message, if the widget is
available.

params.name: msg
params.description: The message to log.

params.name: cat
params.description:
The log category for the message.  Default
categories are "info", "warn", "error", time".
Custom categories can be used as well. (opt)

params.name: src
params.description: The source of the the message (opt)

YAHOO.util.Anim.name: YAHOO.util.Anim

params.name: el
params.description: Reference to the element that will be animated

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attribute(s) to be animated.  
Each attribute is an object with at minimum a "to" or "by" member defined.  
Additional optional members are "from" (defaults to current value), "units" (defaults to "px").  
All attribute names use camelCase.

params.name: duration
params.description: (optional, defaults to 1 second) Length of animation (frames or seconds), defaults to time-based

params.name: method
params.description: (optional, defaults to YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone) Computes the values that are applied to the attributes per frame (generally a YAHOO.util.Easing method)

constructors.description:
Base animation class that provides the interface for building animated effects.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Anim(el, { width: { from: 10, to: 100 } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

onComplete.description:
Custom event that fires when animation ends
Listen via subscribe method (e.g. myAnim.onComplete.subscribe(someFunction)

onStart.description:
Custom event that fires when animation begins
Listen via subscribe method (e.g. myAnim.onStart.subscribe(someFunction)

onTween.description:
Custom event that fires between each frame
Listen via subscribe method (e.g. myAnim.onTween.subscribe(someFunction)

return.description: current value of isAnimated.

isAnimated.description: Checks whether the element is currently animated.

return.description: val The current value of the attribute.

params.name: attr
params.description: The name of the attribute.

getAttribute.description: Returns current value of the attribute.

params.name: attr
params.description: The name of the attribute.

params.name: val
params.description: The value to be applied to the attribute.

params.name: unit
params.description: The unit ('px', '%', etc.) of the value.

setAttribute.description: Applies a value to an attribute.

onTween.description: Feeds the starting and ending values for each animated attribute to doMethod once per frame, then applies the resulting value to the attribute(s).

return.description: The Value to be applied to the attribute.

params.name: attr
params.description: The name of the attribute.

params.name: start
params.description: The value this attribute should start from for this animation.

params.name: end
params.description: The value this attribute should end at for this animation.

doMethod.description: Returns the value computed by the animation's "method".

getEl.description: Returns a reference to the animated element.

params.name: attr
params.description: The attribute object

setRuntimeAttribute.description: Sets the actual values to be used during the animation.  Should only be needed for subclass use.

params.name: finish
params.description: (optional) If true, animation will jump to final frame.

stop.description: Stops the animation.  Normally called by AnimMgr when animation completes.

params.name: el
params.description: Reference to the element that will be animated

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attribute(s) to be animated.  
Each attribute is an object with at minimum a "to" or "by" member defined.  
Additional optional members are "from" (defaults to current value), "units" (defaults to "px").  
All attribute names use camelCase.

params.name: duration
params.description: (optional, defaults to 1 second) Length of animation (frames or seconds), defaults to time-based

params.name: method
params.description: (optional, defaults to YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone) Computes the values that are applied to the attributes per frame (generally a YAHOO.util.Easing method)

init.description: Constructor for Anim instance.

toString.description: Provides a readable name for the Anim instance.

return.description: The default unit to be used.

params.name: attr
params.description: The name of the attribute.

getDefaultUnit.description: Returns the unit to use when none is supplied.

animate.description: Starts the animation by registering it with the animation manager.

return.description: current value of startTime.

isAnimated.description: Whether or not the animation is running.

_onTween.description: Custom event that fires after onTween

actualFrames.description: The number of frames this animation was able to execute.

useSeconds.description:
Whether or not the duration should be treated as seconds.
Defaults to true.

totalFrames.description:
The total number of frames to be executed.
In time-based animations, this is used by AnimMgr to ensure the animation finishes on time.

_onStart.description: Custom event that fires after onStart, useful in subclassing

_onComplete.description: Custom event that fires after onComplete

startTime.description: A Date object that is created when the animation begins.

duration.description: The length of the animation.  Defaults to "1" (second).

attributes.description:
The collection of attributes to be animated.  
Each attribute must have at least a "to" or "by" defined in order to animate.  
If "to" is supplied, the animation will end with the attribute at that value.  
If "by" is supplied, the animation will end at that value plus its starting value. 
If both are supplied, "to" is used, and "by" is ignored. 
Optional additional member include "from" (the value the attribute should start animating from, defaults to current value), and "unit" (the units to apply to the values).

method.description:
The method that will provide values to the attribute(s) during the animation. 
Defaults to "YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone".

currentFrame.description:
The location of the current animation on the timeline.
In time-based animations, this is used by AnimMgr to ensure the animation finishes on time.

YAHOO.util.Anim.description:
Base animation class that provides the interface for building animated effects.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Anim(el, { width: { from: 10, to: 100 } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

YAHOO.util.UserAction.name: YAHOO.util.UserAction

fireKeyEvent.description:
Fires an event that normally would be fired by the keyboard (keyup,
keydown, keypress). Make sure to specify either keyCode or charCode as
an option.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of event ("keyup", "keydown" or "keypress").

params.name: target
params.description: The target of the event.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options for the event. Either keyCode or charCode
are required.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to click on.

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of event to fire. This can be any one of
the following: click, dblclick, mousedown, mouseup, mouseout,
mouseover, and mousemove.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

mouseEvent.description: Simulates a mouse event on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

keypress.description: Simulates a keypress on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

keyup.description: Simulates a keyup event on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

mouseup.description: Simulates a mouseup on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

keydown.description: Simulates a keydown event on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

mousemove.description: Simulates a mousemove on a particular element.

simulateMouseEvent.description:
Simulates a mouse event using the given event information to populate
the generated event object. This method does browser-equalizing
calculations to account for differences in the DOM and IE event models
as well as different browser quirks.

params.name: target
params.description: The target of the given event.

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of event to fire. This can be any one of
the following: click, dblclick, mousedown, mouseup, mouseout,
mouseover, and mousemove.

params.name: bubbles
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if the event can be
bubbled up. DOM Level 2 specifies that all mouse events bubble by
default. The default is true.

params.name: cancelable
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if the event can be
canceled using preventDefault(). DOM Level 2 specifies that all
mouse events except mousemove can be cancelled. The default 
is true for all events except mousemove, for which the default 
is false.

params.name: view
params.description:
(Optional) The view containing the target. This is
typically the window object. The default is window.

params.name: detail
params.description:
(Optional) The number of times the mouse button has
been used. The default value is 1.

params.name: screenX
params.description:
(Optional) The x-coordinate on the screen at which
point the event occured. The default is 0.

params.name: screenY
params.description:
(Optional) The y-coordinate on the screen at which
point the event occured. The default is 0.

params.name: clientX
params.description:
(Optional) The x-coordinate on the client at which
point the event occured. The default is 0.

params.name: clientY
params.description:
(Optional) The y-coordinate on the client at which
point the event occured. The default is 0.

params.name: ctrlKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the CTRL keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: altKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the ALT keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: shiftKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the SHIFT keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: metaKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the META keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: button
params.description:
(Optional) The button being pressed while the event
is executing. The value should be 0 for the primary mouse button
(typically the left button), 1 for the terciary mouse button
(typically the middle button), and 2 for the secondary mouse button
(typically the right button). The default is 0.

params.name: relatedTarget
params.description:
(Optional) For mouseout events,
this is the element that the mouse has moved to. For mouseover
events, this is the element that the mouse has moved from. This
argument is ignored for all other events. The default is null.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

mousedown.description: Simulates a mousedown on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

mouseout.description:
Simulates a mouseout event on a particular element. Use "relatedTarget"
on the options object to specify where the mouse moved to.
Quirks: Firefox less than 2.0 doesn't set relatedTarget properly, so
toElement is assigned in its place. IE doesn't allow toElement to be
be assigned, so relatedTarget is assigned in its place. Both of these
concessions allow YAHOO.util.Event.getRelatedTarget() to work correctly
in both browsers.

simulateKeyEvent.description:
Simulates a key event using the given event information to populate
the generated event object. This method does browser-equalizing
calculations to account for differences in the DOM and IE event models
as well as different browser quirks. Note: keydown causes Safari 2.x to
crash.

params.name: target
params.description: The target of the given event.

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of event to fire. This can be any one of
the following: keyup, keydown, and keypress.

params.name: bubbles
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if the event can be
bubbled up. DOM Level 3 specifies that all key events bubble by
default. The default is true.

params.name: cancelable
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if the event can be
canceled using preventDefault(). DOM Level 3 specifies that all
key events can be cancelled. The default 
is true.

params.name: view
params.description:
(Optional) The view containing the target. This is
typically the window object. The default is window.

params.name: ctrlKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the CTRL keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: altKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the ALT keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: shiftKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the SHIFT keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: metaKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the META keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: keyCode
params.description:
(Optional) The code for the key that is in use. 
The default is 0.

params.name: charCode
params.description:
(Optional) The Unicode code for the character
associated with the key being used. The default is 0.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

mouseover.description:
Simulates a mouseover event on a particular element. Use "relatedTarget"
on the options object to specify where the mouse moved from.
Quirks: Firefox less than 2.0 doesn't set relatedTarget properly, so
fromElement is assigned in its place. IE doesn't allow fromElement to be
be assigned, so relatedTarget is assigned in its place. Both of these
concessions allow YAHOO.util.Event.getRelatedTarget() to work correctly
in both browsers.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to click on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

click.description: Simulates a click on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to double click on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

dblclick.description: Simulates a double click on a particular element.

YAHOO.util.UserAction.description:
The UserAction object provides functions that simulate events occurring in
the browser. Since these are simulated events, they do not behave exactly
as regular, user-initiated events do, but can be used to test simple
user interactions safely.

YAHOO.widget.Tab.name: YAHOO.widget.Tab

disabled.description: Whether or not the tab is disabled.

dataTimeout.description: Number if milliseconds before aborting and calling failure handler.

contentEl.description: The HTMLElement that contains the tab's content.

href.description: The href of the tab's anchor element.

cacheData.description: Whether or not content should be reloaded for every view.

dataSrc.description: The tab's data source, used for loading content dynamically.

loadMethod.description: The method to use for the data request.

contentVisible.description: The Whether or not the tab's content is visible.

activationEvent.description: The event that triggers the tab's activation.

active.description:
Whether or not the tab is currently active.
If a dataSrc is set for the tab, the content will be loaded from
the given source.

labelEl.description: The element that contains the tab's label.

dataLoaded.description: Whether or not any data has been loaded from the server.

params.name: element
params.description:
(optional) The html element that 
represents the TabView. An element will be created if none provided.

params.name: properties
params.description: A key map of initial properties

constructors.description: A representation of a Tab's label and content.

contentChange.description:
Fires after the tab content is changed.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type contentChange
<String> prevValue the previous value
<Boolean> newValue the updated value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('contentChange', handler);

activeChange.description:
Fires after the active state is changed.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type activeChange
<Boolean> prevValue the previous value
<Boolean> newValue the updated value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('activeChange', handler);

beforeContentChange.description:
Fires before the tab content is changed.

See: Element.addListener

If handler returns false, the change will be cancelled, and the value will not be set.

Event fields:
<String> type beforeContentChange
<String> prevValue the current value
<String> newValue the new value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('beforeContentChange', handler);

beforeActiveChange.description:
Fires before the active state is changed.

See: Element.addListener

If handler returns false, the change will be cancelled, and the value will not be set.

Event fields:
<String> type beforeActiveChange
<Boolean> prevValue the current value
<Boolean> newValue the new value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('beforeActiveChange', handler);

labelChange.description:
Fires after the tab label is changed.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type labelChange
<String> prevValue the previous value
<String> newValue the updated value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('labelChange', handler);

beforeLabelChange.description:
Fires before the tab label is changed.

See: Element.addListener

If handler returns false, the change will be cancelled, and the value will not be set.

Event fields:
<String> type beforeLabelChange
<String> prevValue the current value
<String> newValue the new value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('beforeLabelChange', handler);

params.name: attr
params.description: Hash of initial attributes

return.description: String

DISABLED_CLASSNAME.description: The class name applied to disabled tabs.

LOADING_CLASSNAME.description: The class name applied to dynamic tabs while loading.

LABEL_INNER_TAGNAME.description: The default tag name for a Tab's inner element.

ACTIVE_CLASSNAME.description: The class name applied to active tabs.

Provides a reference to the connection request object when data is
loaded dynamically.

YAHOO.widget.Tab.description: A representation of a Tab's label and content.

YAHOO.widget.Menu.name: YAHOO.widget.Menu

classname.description: CSS class to be applied to the menu's root <div> element. The specified class(es) are appended in addition to the default class as specified by the menu's CSS_CLASS_NAME constant.

autosubmenudisplay.description:
Boolean indicating if submenus are automatically made 
visible when the user mouses over the menu's items.

clicktohide.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu will automatically be 
hidden if the user clicks outside of it.

submenualignment.description:
Array defining how submenus should be aligned to their 
parent menu item. The format is: [itemCorner, submenuCorner]. By default
a submenu's top left corner is aligned to its parent menu item's top 
right corner.

constraintoviewport.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu will try to remain inside 
the boundaries of the size of viewport.

maxheight.description:
Defines the maximum height (in pixels) for a menu before the
contents of the body are scrolled.

showdelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should 
expire before a submenu is made visible when the user mouses over 
the menu's items.

submenuhidedelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should 
expire before a submenu is hidden when the user mouses out of a menu item 
heading in the direction of a submenu.  The value must be greater than or 
equal to the value specified for the "showdelay" configuration property.

visible.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the menu is visible. If the menu's "position" configuration property is set to "dynamic" (the default), this property toggles the menu's <div> element's "visibility" style property between "visible" (true) or "hidden" (false). If the menu's "position" configuration property is set to "static" this property toggles the menu's <div> element's "display" style property between "block" (true) or "none" (false).

container.description:
HTML element reference or string specifying the id 
attribute of the HTML element that the menu's markup should be 
rendered into.

disabled.description: Boolean indicating if the menu should be disabled. Disabling a menu disables each of its items. (Disabled menu items are dimmed and will not respond to user input or fire events.) Disabled menus have a corresponding "disabled" CSS class applied to their root <div> element.

position.description:
String indicating how a menu should be positioned on the 
screen.  Possible values are "static" and "dynamic."  Static menus are 
visible by default and reside in the normal flow of the document 
(CSS position: static).  Dynamic menus are hidden by default, reside 
out of the normal flow of the document (CSS position: absolute), and 
can overlay other elements on the screen.

hidedelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should 
expire before the menu is hidden.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <div> element of the menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <select> element to be used as the data source for the menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <div> element of the menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <select> element to be used as the data source for the menu.

params.name: p_oConfig
params.description:
Optional. Object literal specifying the 
configuration for the menu. See configuration class documentation for 
more details.

constructors.description:
The Menu class creates a container that holds a vertical list representing 
a set of options or commands.  Menu is the base class for all 
menu containers.

mouseOutEvent.description:
Fires when the mouse has left the menu.  Passes back the DOM 
Event object as an argument.

mouseUpEvent.description:
Fires when the user releases a mouse button while the mouse is 
over the menu.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

keyUpEvent.description:
Fires when the user releases a key when one of the menu's items 
has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

keyPressEvent.description:
Fires when the user presses an alphanumeric key when one of the
menu's items has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

itemAddedEvent.description: Fires when an item is added to the menu.

mouseOverEvent.description:
Fires when the mouse has entered the menu.  Passes back 
the DOM Event object as an argument.

itemRemovedEvent.description: Fires when an item is removed to the menu.

mouseDownEvent.description:
Fires when the user mouses down on the menu.  Passes back the 
DOM Event object as an argument.

clickEvent.description:
Fires when the user clicks the on the menu.  Passes back the 
DOM Event object as an argument.

keyDownEvent.description:
Fires when the user presses a key when one of the menu's items 
has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

from executing.

strings representing the text for each item to be created, object literals 
representing the menu item configuration properties, or MenuItem instances.  
This property should be set via the constructor using the configuration 
object literal.

parent.description:
Object reference to the menu's parent menu or menu item.  
This property can be set via the constructor using the configuration 
object literal.

Number representing the time-out setting used to cancel the 
hiding of a submenu.

Number representing the time-out setting used to cancel the 
scrolling of the menu's body element.

"mouseout" event.

lazyLoad.description:

enabled.  If set to "true," initialization and rendering of the menu's 
items will be deferred until the first time it is made visible.  This 
property should be set via the constructor using the configuration 
object literal.

_aListElements.description: Array of <ul> elements, each of which is the parent node for each item's <li> element.

_aItemGroups.description:
Multi-dimensional Array representing the menu items as they
are grouped in the menu.

DEFAULT_CONFIG.description: Constant representing the Menu's configuration properties

GROUP_TITLE_TAG_NAME.description:
String representing the tagname of the HTML element used to 
title the menu's item groups.

_bHideDelayEventHandlersAssigned.description:
Boolean indicating if the "mouseover" and "mouseout" event 
handlers used for hiding the menu via a call to "window.setTimeout" have 
already been assigned.

_nMaxHeight.description:
The original value of the "maxheight" configuration property 
as set by the user.

YAHOO.widget.Menu.description:
The Menu class creates a container that holds a vertical list representing 
a set of options or commands.  Menu is the base class for all 
menu containers.

YAHOO.widget.Slider.name: YAHOO.widget.Slider

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the element linked to this instance

params.name: sGroup
params.description: The group of related DragDrop items

params.name: oThumb
params.description: The thumb for this slider

params.name: sType
params.description: The type of slider (horiz, vert, region)

constructors.description:
A DragDrop implementation that can be used as a background for a
slider.  It takes a reference to the thumb instance 
so it can delegate some of the events to it.  The goal is to make the 
thumb jump to the location on the background when the background is 
clicked.

slideEnd.description: Event that fires at the end of a slider thumb move

params.name: newOffset|x
params.description:
the new offset for normal sliders, or the new
x offset for region sliders

params.name: y
params.description:
the number of pixels the thumb has moved on the y axis
(region sliders only)

change.description:
Event the fires when the value of the control changes.  If 
the control is animated the event will fire every point
along the way.

slideStart.description: Event that fires at the beginning of a slider thumb move.

params.name: thumbEvent
params.description:
set to true if this event is fired from an event
that occurred on the thumb.  If it is, the state of the
thumb dd object should be correct.  Otherwise, the event
originated on the background, so the thumb state needs to
be refreshed before proceeding.

fireEvents.description:
Fires the change event if the value has been changed.  Ignored if we are in
the middle of an animation as the event will fire when the animation is
complete

return.description: a horizontal slider control

YAHOO.widget.Slider.getHorizSlider.description: Factory method for creating a horizontal slider

params.name: sBGElId
params.description: the id of the slider's background element

params.name: sHandleElId
params.description: the id of the thumb element

params.name: iLeft
params.description: the number of pixels the element can move left

params.name: iRight
params.description: the number of pixels the element can move right

params.name: iTickSize
params.description:
optional parameter for specifying that the element 
should move a certain number pixels at a time.

focus.description:
Try to focus the element when clicked so we can add
accessibility features

onMouseDown.description: Handles the mousedown event for the slider background

params.name: e
params.description: the keydown event

handleKeyDown.description:
Executed when a keydown event happens with the control focused.
Updates the slider value and display when the keypress is an
arrow key, home, or end as long as enableKeys is set to true.

return.description: the current horizontal offset

getXValue.description: Returns the slider's thumb X offset from the start position

params.name: x
params.description: the X coordinate of the click

params.name: y
params.description: the Y coordinate of the click

params.name: skipAnim
params.description: don't animate if the move happend onDrag

moveThumb.description:
Move the associated slider moved to a timeout to try to get around the 
mousedown stealing moz does when I move the slider element between the 
cursor and the background during the mouseup event

return.description: true if the move was performed, false if it failed

params.name: newOffset
params.description:
the number of pixels the thumb should be
positioned away from the initial start point (x axis for region)

params.name: newOffset2
params.description:
the number of pixels the thumb should be
positioned away from the initial start point (y axis for region)

params.name: skipAnim
params.description:
set to true to disable the animation

picker example

baseline position, the constraints for the thumb are reset

Move the slider one tick mark towards its final coordinate.  Used
for the animation when tick marks are defined

params.description:
the number of pixels the thumb has moved
from its start position. Normal horizontal and vertical sliders will only
have the firstOffset.  Regions will have both, the first is the horizontal
offset, the second the vertical.

params.description: the y offset for region sliders

the number of pixels the thumb should be

setValue.description: Provides a way to set the value of the slider in code.

setThumbCenterPoint.description:
When the thumb is available, we cache the centerpoint of the element so
we can position the element correctly when the background is clicked

handleThumbChange.description: Internal handler for the slider thumb's onChange event

endMove.description: Fired when the slider movement ends

return.description: the current vertical offset

getYValue.description: Returns the slider's thumb Y offset from the start position

YAHOO.widget.Slider.getVertSlider.description: Factory method for creating a vertical slider

params.name: sBGElId
params.description: the id of the slider's background element

params.name: sHandleElId
params.description: the id of the thumb element

params.name: iUp
params.description: the number of pixels the element can move up

params.name: iDown
params.description: the number of pixels the element can move down

params.name: iTickSize
params.description:
optional parameter for specifying that the element 
should move a certain number pixels at a time.

params.name: e
params.description: the keypress event

handleKeyPress.description:
Executed when a keypress event happens with the control focused.
Prevents the default behavior for navigation keys.  The actual
logic for moving the slider thumb in response to a key event
happens in handleKeyDown.

setStartSliderState.description: Initialization that sets up the value offsets once the elements are ready

return.description: the current value

getValue.description: Returns the slider's thumb offset from the start position

b4MouseDown.description: Resets the constraints before moving the thumb.

_getNextY.description: Returns the next Y tick value based on the current coord and the target coord.

_getNextX.description: Returns the next X tick value based on the current coord and the target coord.

moveComplete.description:
moveComplete is set to true when the slider has moved to its final
destination.  For animated slider, this value can be checked in 
the onChange handler to make it possible to execute logic only
when the move is complete rather than at all points along the way.
Deprecated because this flag is only useful when the background is
clicked and the slider is animated.  If the user drags the thumb,
the flag is updated when the drag is over ... the final onDrag event
fires before the mouseup the ends the drag, so the implementer will
never see it.

isTarget.description: Overrides the isTarget property in YAHOO.util.DragDrop

thumb.description:
A YAHOO.widget.SliderThumb instance that we will use to 
reposition the thumb when the background is clicked

baselinePos.description:
The basline position of the background element, used
to determine if the background has moved since the last
operation.

thumbCenterPoint.description:
The center of the slider element is stored so we can 
place it in the correct position when the background is clicked.

SOURCE_SET_VALUE.description:
Constant for valueChangeSource, indicating that the value was altered
by a programmatic call to setValue/setRegionValue.

SOURCE_UI_EVENT.description:
Constant for valueChangeSource, indicating that the user clicked or
dragged the slider to change the value.

keyIncrement.description:
Specifies the number of pixels the arrow keys will move the slider.
Default is 25.

valueChangeSource.description:
When the slider value changes, this property is set to identify where
the update came from.  This will be either 1, meaning the slider was
clicked or dragged, or 2, meaning that it was set via a setValue() call.
This can be used within event handlers to apply some of the logic only
when dealing with one source or another.

backgroundEnabled.description: Set to false to disable a background click thumb move

animationDuration.description:
If animation is configured, specifies the length of the animation
in seconds.

YAHOO.widget.Slider.ANIM_AVAIL.description: By default, animation is available if the animation library is detected.

type.description: The type of the slider (horiz, vert, region)

animate.description: Flag that determines if the thumb will animate when moved

tickPause.description:
Adjustment factor for tick animation, the more ticks, the
faster the animation (by default)

enableKeys.description: Enables the arrow, home and end keys, defaults to true.

YAHOO.widget.Slider.description:
A DragDrop implementation that can be used as a background for a
slider.  It takes a reference to the thumb instance 
so it can delegate some of the events to it.  The goal is to make the 
thumb jump to the location on the background when the background is 
clicked.

YAHOO.widget.ContextMenu.name: YAHOO.widget.ContextMenu

trigger.description:
The HTML element(s) whose "contextmenu" event ("mousedown" 
for Opera) trigger the display of the context menu.  Can be a string 
representing the id attribute of the HTML element, an object reference 
for the HTML element, or an array of strings or HTML element references.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <div> element of the context menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <select> element to be used as the data source for the context menu.

params.description: Object specifying the <select> element to be used as the data source for the context menu.

Optional. Object literal specifying the 
configuration for the context menu. See configuration class documentation 
for more details.

constructors.description:
Creates a list of options or commands which are made visible in response to 
an HTML element's "contextmenu" event ("mousedown" for Opera).

triggerContextMenuEvent.description:
Custom Event wrapper for the "contextmenu" DOM event 
("mousedown" for Opera) fired by the element(s) that trigger the display of 
the context menu.

initEvents.description: Initializes the custom events for the context menu.

params.name: p_oEvent
params.description:
Object representing the DOM event object passed back 
by the event utility (YAHOO.util.Event).

params.name: p_oMenu
params.description:
Object representing the context 
menu that is handling the event.

_onTriggerClick.description:
"click" event handler for the HTML element(s) identified as the 
"trigger" for the context menu.  Used to cancel default behaviors in Opera.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <div> element of the context menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <select> element to be used as the data source for the context menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <div> element of the context menu.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object specifying the <select> element to be used as the data source for the context menu.

params.name: p_oConfig
params.description:
Optional. Object literal specifying the 
configuration for the context menu. See configuration class documentation 
for more details.

init.description:
The ContextMenu class's initialization method. This method is 
automatically called by the constructor, and sets up all DOM references for 
pre-existing markup, and creates required markup if it is not already present.

toString.description: Returns a string representing the context menu.

initDefaultConfig.description:
Initializes the class's configurable properties which can be 
changed using the context menu's Config object ("cfg").

cancel.description: Cancels the display of the context menu.

destroy.description: Removes the context menu's <div> element (and accompanying child nodes) from the document.

params.name: p_oEvent
params.description:
Object representing the DOM event object passed back 
by the event utility (YAHOO.util.Event).

params.name: p_oMenu
params.description:
Object representing the context 
menu that is handling the event.

_onTriggerContextMenu.description:
"contextmenu" event handler ("mousedown" for Opera) for the HTML 
element(s) that trigger the display of the context menu.

_removeEventHandlers.description:
Removes all of the DOM event handlers from the HTML element(s) 
whose "context menu" event ("click" for Opera) trigger the display of 
the context menu.

params.name: p_sType
params.description:
String representing the name of the event that 
was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description: Array of arguments sent when the event was fired.

params.name: p_oMenu
params.description:
Object representing the context 
menu that fired the event.

configTrigger.description:
Event handler for when the value of the "trigger" configuration 
property changes.

_oTrigger.description:
Object reference to the current value of the "trigger" 
configuration property.

contextEventTarget.description:
Object reference for the HTML element that was the target of the
"contextmenu" DOM event ("mousedown" for Opera) that triggered the display of 
the context menu.

EVENT_TYPES.description: Constant representing the name of the ContextMenu's events

DEFAULT_CONFIG.description: Constant representing the ContextMenu's configuration properties

_bCancelled.description:
Boolean indicating if the display of the context menu should 
be cancelled.

YAHOO.widget.ContextMenu.description:
Creates a list of options or commands which are made visible in response to 
an HTML element's "contextmenu" event ("mousedown" for Opera).

by DragDrop.removeFromGroup, so don't call this function directly.

time threshold has been met.

stopDrag.description:
Ends the current drag, cleans up the state, and fires the endDrag
and mouseUp events.  Called internally when a mouseup is detected
during the drag.  Can be fired manually during the drag by passing
either another event (such as the mousemove event received in onDrag)
or a fake event with pageX and pageY defined (so that endDrag and
onMouseUp have usable position data.).  Alternatively, pass true
for the silent parameter so that the endDrag and onMouseUp events
are skipped (so no event data is needed.)

refreshCache.description: Refreshes the cache of the top-left and bottom-right points of the drag and drop objects in the specified group(s). This is in the format that is stored in the drag and drop instance, so typical usage is: YAHOO.util.DragDropMgr.refreshCache(ddinstance.groups); Alternatively: YAHOO.util.DragDropMgr.refreshCache({group1:true, group2:true});

params.name: groups
params.description: an associative array of groups to refresh

refreshCache.todo:
this really should be an indexed array.  Alternatively this
method could accept both.

return.description:
true if this element is a DragDrop handle, false 
otherwise

isHandle.description:
Utility function to determine if a given element has been 
registered as a drag drop handle for the given Drag Drop object.

params.name: id
params.description: the element id to check

handleMouseUp.description:
Internal function to handle the mouseup event.  Will be invoked 
from the context of the document.

params.name: e
params.description: the event

return.description: true if the element looks usable

verifyEl.description:
This checks to make sure an element exists and is in the DOM.  The
main purpose is to handle cases where innerHTML is used to remove
drag and drop objects from the DOM.  IE provides an 'unspecified
error' when trying to access the offsetParent of such an element

params.name: el
params.description: the element to check

params.name: moveEl
params.description: The element to move

params.name: targetEl
params.description: The position reference element

moveToEl.description:
Sets the x/y position of an element to the location of the
target element.

dragThreshMet.description:
Flag that indicates that either the drag pixel threshold or the 
mousdown time threshold has been met

clickPixelThresh.description:
The number of pixels that the mouse needs to move after the 
mousedown before the drag is initiated.  Default=3;

initialized.description:
Internal flag that is set to true when drag and drop has been
initialized

stopPropagation.description:
Flag to determine if we should stop the propagation of the events 
we generate. This is true by default but you may want to set it to
false if the html element contains other features that require the
mouse click.

handleIds.description:
Array of element ids defined as drag handles.  Used to determine 
if the element that generated the mousedown event is actually the 
handle and not the html element itself.

POINT.description:
In point mode, drag and drop interaction is defined by the 
location of the cursor during the drag/drop

deltaX.description: the X distance between the cursor and the object being dragged

deltaY.description: the Y distance between the cursor and the object being dragged

dragOvers.description: the DragDrop object(s) that are being hovered over

useCache.description:
Set useCache to false if you want to force object the lookup of each
drag and drop linked element constantly during a drag.

clickTimeThresh.description:
The number of milliseconds after the mousedown event to initiate the
drag if we don't get a mouseup event. Default=1000

startX.description:
The X position of the mousedown event stored for later use when a 
drag threshold is met.

startY.description:
The Y position of the mousedown event stored for later use when a 
drag threshold is met.

clickTimeout.description: Timeout used for the click time threshold

STRICT_INTERSECT.description:
In intersect mode, drag and drop interaction is defined only by the 
overlap of two or more drag and drop objects.

interactionInfo.description:
Provides additional information about the the current set of
interactions.  Can be accessed from the event handlers. It
contains the following properties:
out:       onDragOut interactions
enter:     onDragEnter interactions
over:      onDragOver interactions
drop:      onDragDrop interactions
point:     The location of the cursor
draggedRegion: The location of dragged element at the time
of the interaction
sourceRegion: The location of the source elemtn at the time
of the interaction
validDrop: boolean

locationCache.description:
Location cache that is set for all drag drop objects when a drag is
initiated, cleared when the drag is finished.

INTERSECT.description:
In intersect mode, drag and drop interaction is defined by the 
cursor position or the amount of overlap of two or more drag and 
drop objects.

locked.description: All drag and drop can be disabled.

dragCurrent.description: the DragDrop object that is currently being dragged

preventDefault.description:
Flag to determine if we should prevent the default behavior of the
events we define. By default this is true, but this can be set to 
false if you need the default behavior (not recommended)

ids.description:
Two dimensional Array of registered DragDrop objects.  The first 
dimension is the DragDrop item group, the second the DragDrop 
object.

mode.description: The current drag and drop mode.  Default: POINT

YAHOO.util.DragDropMgr.description:
DragDropMgr is a singleton that tracks the element interaction for 
all DragDrop items in the window.  Generally, you will not call 
this class directly, but it does have helper methods that could 
be useful in your DragDrop implementations.

YAHOO.util.Scroll.name: YAHOO.util.Scroll

params.name: el
params.description: Reference to the element that will be animated

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attribute(s) to be animated.  
Each attribute is an object with at minimum a "to" or "by" member defined.  
Additional optional members are "from" (defaults to current value), "units" (defaults to "px").  
All attribute names use camelCase.

params.name: duration
params.description: (optional, defaults to 1 second) Length of animation (frames or seconds), defaults to time-based

params.name: method
params.description: (optional, defaults to YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone) Computes the values that are applied to the attributes per frame (generally a YAHOO.util.Easing method)

constructors.description:
Anim subclass for scrolling elements to a position defined by the "scroll" member of "attributes". All "scroll" members are arrays with x, y scroll positions.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Scroll(el, { scroll: { to: [0, 800] } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

YAHOO.util.Scroll.description:
Anim subclass for scrolling elements to a position defined by the "scroll" member of "attributes". All "scroll" members are arrays with x, y scroll positions.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Scroll(el, { scroll: { to: [0, 800] } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

return.description: true if the date overlaps two different years.

params.description:
OPTIONAL - The calendar year to use for determining the week number. Default is
the calendar year of parameter "date".

getWeekNumber.description:
Calculates the week number for the given date. This function assumes that week 1 is the
week in which January 1 appears, regardless of whether the week consists of a full 7 days.
The calendar year can be specified to help find what a the week number would be for a given
date if the date overlaps years. For instance, a week may be considered week 1 of 2005, or
week 53 of 2004. Specifying the optional calendarYear allows one to make this distinction
easily.

return.description: The number of days since January 1 of the given year

params.name: date
params.description: The JavaScript date for which to find the offset

params.name: calendarYear
params.description: The calendar year to use for determining the offset

getDayOffset.description:
Calculates the number of days the specified date is from January 1 of the specified calendar year.
Passing January 1 to this function would return an offset value of zero.

return.description: Returns the connection object

params.description: Fully qualified path of resource

params.description: User-defined callback function or object

params.description: POST body

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object returned by asyncRequest

createResponseObject.description:
This method evaluates the server response, creates and returns the results via
its properties.  Success and failure cases will differ in the response
object's property values.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object

params.name: callbackArg
params.description: The user-defined argument or arguments to be passed to the callback

initCustomEvents.description:
This method creates and subscribes custom events,
specific to each transaction

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object

params.name: callback
params.description: The user-defined callback object

initHeader.description: Method that initializes the custom HTTP headers for the each transaction.

params.name: label

params.name: value

Determines if the specific header is a default header
automatically sent with each transaction.

return.description: void

params.description: Set and use default header - true or false .

return.description: string of the HTML form field name and value pairs..

setForm.description:
This method assembles the form label and value pairs and
constructs an encoded string.
asyncRequest() will automatically initialize the transaction with a
a HTTP header Content-Type of application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

params.name: form
params.description: id or name attribute, or form object.

params.name: optional
params.description: enable file upload.

params.name: optional
params.description: enable file upload over SSL in IE only.

Uploads HTML form, inclusive of files/attachments, using the
iframe created in createFrame to facilitate the transaction.

params.name: id
params.description: The transaction id.

params.name: callback
params.description: User-defined callback object.

params.name: uri
params.description: Fully qualified path of resource.

params.name: postData
params.description: POST data to be submitted in addition to HTML form.

resetFormState.description:
Resets HTML form properties when an HTML form or HTML form
with file upload transaction is sent.

getConnectionObject.description:
This method is called by asyncRequest to create a
valid connection object for the transaction.  It also passes a
transaction id and increments the transaction id counter.

createExceptionObject.description:
If a transaction cannot be completed due to dropped or closed connections,
there may be not be enough information to build a full response object.
The failure callback will be fired and this specific condition can be identified
by a status property value of 0.
If an abort was successful, the status property will report a value of -1.

params.name: tId
params.description: The Transaction Id

params.name: callbackArg
params.description: The user-defined argument or arguments to be passed to the callback

params.name: isAbort
params.description: Determines if the exception case is caused by a transaction abort

resetDefaultHeaders.description: Resets the default HTTP headers object

return.description: formElements Collection of hidden fields.

appendPostData.description:
Parses the POST data and creates hidden form elements
for each key-value, and appends them to the HTML form object.

params.name: postData
params.description: The HTTP POST data

releaseObject.description: Dereference the XHR instance and the connection object after the transaction is completed.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object

return.description: object

createXhrObject.description:
Instantiates a XMLHttpRequest object and returns an object with two properties:
the XMLHttpRequest instance and the transaction id.

params.name: transactionId
params.description: Property containing the transaction id for this transaction.

handleTransactionResponse.description:
This method attempts to interpret the server response and
determine whether the transaction was successful, or if an error or
exception was encountered.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object

params.name: callback
params.description: The user-defined callback object

params.name: isAbort
params.description: Determines if the transaction was terminated via abort().

createFrame.description:
Creates an iframe to be used for form file uploads.  It is remove from the
document upon completion of the upload transaction.

params.name: optional
params.description: qualified path of iframe resource for SSL in IE.

handleReadyState.description:
This method serves as a timer that polls the XHR object's readyState
property during a transaction, instead of binding a callback to the
onreadystatechange event.  Upon readyState 4, handleTransactionResponse
will process the response, and the timer will be cleared.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object

params.name: callback
params.description: The user-defined callback object

return.description: void

setDefaultPostHeader.description: Member to enable or disable the default POST header.

params.name: b
params.description: Set and use default header - true or false .

abort.description: Method to terminate a transaction, if it has not reached readyState 4.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object returned by asyncRequest.

params.name: callback
params.description: User-defined callback object.

params.name: isTimeout
params.description: boolean to indicate if abort resulted from a callback timeout.

return.description: void

setProgId.description:
Member to add an ActiveX id to the existing xml_progid array.
In the event(unlikely) a new ActiveX id is introduced, it can be added
without internal code modifications.

params.name: id
params.description: The ActiveX id to be added to initialize the XHR object.

return.description: void

setPollingInterval.description: Member to modify the default polling interval.

params.name: i
params.description: The polling interval in milliseconds.

setHeader.description: Accessor that sets the HTTP headers for each transaction.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object for the transaction.

successEvent.description:
Custom event that fires when handleTransactionResponse() determines a
response in the HTTP 2xx range.

_default_xhr_header.description:
The default header value for the label
"X-Requested-With".  This is sent with each
transaction, by default, to identify the
request as being made by YUI Connection Manager.

completeEvent.description: Custom event that fires when a transaction response has completed.

_polling_interval.description:
The polling frequency, in milliseconds, for HandleReadyState.
when attempting to determine a transaction's XHR readyState.
The default is 50 milliseconds.

_formNode.description:
Property modified by setForm() to set a reference to the HTML
form node if the desired action is file upload.

_msxml_progid.description: Array of MSFT ActiveX ids for XMLHttpRequest.

_sFormData.description:
Property modified by setForm() to set the HTML form data
for each transaction.

_default_post_header.description:
Determines if a default header of
Content-Type of 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'
will be added to client HTTP headers sent for POST
transactions.

_isFormSubmit.description:
Property modified by setForm() to determine if the data
should be submitted as an HTML form.

_has_default_header.description:
Determines if custom, default headers
are set for each transaction.

_hasSubmitListener.description:
Determines whether YAHOO.util.Event is available and returns true or false.
If true, an event listener is bound at the document level to trap click events that
resolve to a target type of "Submit".  This listener will enable setForm() to determine
the clicked "Submit" value in a multi-Submit button, HTML form.

_use_default_xhr_header.description:
Determines if a default header of
'X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest'
will be added to each transaction.

_poll.description: Collection of polling references to the polling mechanism in handleReadyState.

_timeOut.description: Queue of timeout values for each transaction callback with a defined timeout value.

abortEvent.description: Custom event that fires when a transaction is successfully aborted.

_transaction_id.description: A transaction counter that increments the transaction id for each transaction.

failureEvent.description:
Custom event that fires when handleTransactionResponse() determines a
response in the HTTP 4xx/5xx range.

_use_default_post_header.description:
Determines if a default header of
Content-Type of 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'
will be added to any client HTTP headers sent for POST
transactions.

_customEvents.description:
A reference table that maps callback custom events members to its specific
event name.

startEvent.description: Custom event that fires at the start of a transaction

_isFileUpload.description:
Property modified by setForm() to determine if a file(s)
upload is expected.

_has_http_headers.description: Determines if HTTP headers are set.

_submitElementValue.description:
Tracks the name-value pair of the "clicked" submit button if multiple submit
buttons are present in an HTML form; and, if YAHOO.util.Event is available.

YAHOO.util.Connect.description:
The Connection Manager singleton provides methods for creating and managing
asynchronous transactions.

className.description:
Class name that will identify images belonging to the group. This class name will be removed from each element in order to fetch images.

_triggers.description:
Collection of triggers for this group.
Keeps track of each trigger's element, event, and event-listener-callback "fetch" function

_timeout.description: Timeout object to keep a handle on the time limit

foldConditional.description: Flag to check if images are above the fold. If foldConditional is true, the group will check each of its image locations at page load. If any part of the image is within the client viewport, the image is displayed immediately

YAHOO.util.ImageLoader.group.description: A group for images. A group can have one time limit and a series of triggers. Thus the images belonging to this group must share these constraints.

constructors.description:
Calendar is the base class for the Calendar widget. In its most basic implementation, it has the ability to render a calendar widget on the page that can be manipulated to select a single date, move back and forth between months and years.

To construct the placeholder for the calendar widget, the code is as follows:

<div id="cal1Container"></div>
